HISTORY: ["12/01/2020 - PREFILED.","12/01/2020 - To HOUSE Committee on CONSTITUTION, CAMPAIGNS AND ELECTIONS.","02/02/2021 - INTRODUCED.","02/02/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on CONSTITUTION, CAMPAIGNS AND ELECTIONS."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to voting rights, amends Sections 15-22-36.1 and 17-3-31, Code of Alabama 1975, removes the process of applying to the Board of Pardons and Paroles for a Certificate of Eligibility to Register to Vote for a person to have his or her right to vote restored, eliminates the requirement that a person pay all fines, court costs, fees, and victim restitution prior to having his or her right to vote restored, expands restoration of voting rights to a person who has been released from incarceration.

HISTORY: ["12/01/2020 - PREFILED.","12/01/2020 - To HOUSE Committee on CONSTITUTION, CAMPAIGNS AND ELECTIONS.","02/02/2021 - INTRODUCED.","02/02/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on CONSTITUTION, CAMPAIGNS AND ELECTIONS."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to absentee voting, amends Section 17-9-30, Code of Alabama 1975, as amended by Act 2019-507, 2019 Regular Session, to add a valid inmate identification card or other form of identification to the list of acceptable forms of identification to vote by absentee ballot.

BILLSUMMARY: Relates to absentee voting, amends Section 17-9-30, Code of Alabama 1975, as amended by Act 2019-507, 2019 Regular Session, to add a valid inmate identification card or other form of identification to the list of acceptable forms of identification to vote by absentee ballot.

BILLSUMMARY: Relates to voting, establishes an advance voting period during which qualified electors, without excuse, may vote at a designated advance voting center before election day, provides for the minimum days and hours of operation for each advance voting center, requires judges of probate to manage advance voting and require appointing boards to appoint poll workers to work at advance voting centers, requires the Secretary of State to adopt rules.

BILLSUMMARY: Relates to elections, requires each county to provide at least one early voting center to be open for a period of 14 days during the week immediately preceding election day, which allows registered voters to vote prior to the official election day, prescribes the hours of operation for each early voting center, clarifies that this act does not impair or affect the powers and duties of boards of registrars, judges of probate, and other election officials.

HISTORY: ["01/26/2021 - PREFILED.","01/26/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on CONSTITUTION, CAMPAIGNS AND ELECTIONS.","02/02/2021 - INTRODUCED.","02/02/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on CONSTITUTION, CAMPAIGNS AND ELECTIONS.","02/24/2021 - From HOUSE Committee on CONSTITUTION, CAMPAIGNS AND ELECTIONS: Reported Favorably.","03/16/2021 - Representative amendment offered on HOUSE floor.","03/16/2021 - Representative amendment lost on HOUSE floor.","03/16/2021 - Representative amendment withdrawn on HOUSE floor.","03/16/2021 - Passed HOUSE.  *****To SENATE.","03/18/2021 - To SENATE Committee on FISCAL RESPONSIBILITY AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT.","04/07/2021 - From SENATE Committee on FISCAL RESPONSIBILITY AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT:  Reported favorably with amendment.","04/20/2021 - Committee amendment offered on SENATE floor.","04/20/2021 - Committee amendment adopted on SENATE floor.","04/20/2021 - Passed SENATE.  *****To HOUSE for concurrence.","04/27/2021 - HOUSE concurred in SENATE amendments.","04/27/2021 - Eligible for GOVERNOR'S desk.","04/27/2021 - *****To GOVERNOR.","05/04/2021 - Signed by GOVERNOR.","05/04/2021 - Act No. 2021-335"]

BILLSUMMARY: Relates to elections, amends Sections 17-3-54 and 17-11-4, Code of State 1975, to prohibit an individual or entity from prefilling any field on a voter registration or absentee ballot application, with exceptions, provides for criminal penalties for violations, connections therewith would have as its purpose or effect the requirement of a new or increased expenditure of local funds within the meaning of Amendment 621 of the Constitution of State of 1901, as amended by Amendment 890.

BILLSUMMARY: Extends the requirements to mail a ballot to every registered voter to all elections and applies them to all local elections officials. Requires a vote by mail tracking system to be accessible to voters with disabilities. Requires county elections officials to permit any voter to cast a ballot using a certified remote accessible vote by mail system for any election. Extends time for a vote by mail ballot to be considered timely cast. Provides for counties that do not conduct an all-mailed ballot election.

BILLSUMMARY: Requires a driver's license or identification card application, renewal, or change of address notification to include a voter registration application and would require the Department of Motor Vehicles to transmit the application to the Secretary of State according to specified deadlines. Requires the Department to monitor the timeliness of its transmittals to the Secretary, and to provide the Secretary information regarding delays and irregularities in its ability to do so. Provides for a task force.

BILLSUMMARY: Establishes the Citizens Redistricting Commission in the County of Riverside, which would be charged with adjusting the boundary lines of the districts of the Board of Supervisors of the County of Riverside. States the commission would consist of 14 members who meet specified qualifications. Requires the commission to adjust the boundaries of the supervisorial districts and adopt a redistricting plan, which would become effective 30 days following its submission to the county elections official.

BILLSUMMARY: Expands the prohibited activities to include obstructing ingress, egress, and parking, and specify that such activities are prohibited within 100 feet of a polling place with the intent of dissuading another person from voting. Requires Secretary of State to notify the candidate of deficiencies in redactions and who does not timely submit corrected hard copies would not be qualified to have their name placed on the ballot of the direct primary election.

BILLSUMMARY: Authorizes a county that has previously conducted an all-mailed ballot election to conduct an all-mailed ballot election prior to a specified date, if it provides, on the day of the election and a certain time preceding the election, a certain amount of centers per registered voters, authorizes a county that has not previously conducted an all-mailed ballot election to conduct an all-mailed ballot election using alternative procedures substantially similar to those in effect for a certain general election.

BILLSUMMARY: Applies a presumption, for purposes of the comparison of signatures in the voters registration record, that the signature on an identification envelope, signature verification statement, unsigned ballot statement, or provisional ballot envelope, is the voters signature. Specifies that an exact signature is not required to determine validity. Prohibits elections official from viewing or considering party preference, race, or ethnicity, when comparing signatures.

BILLSUMMARY: NA

HISTORY: "02/01/2022 - In SENATE.  Returned to Secretary of Senate pursuant to Joint Rule 56."
BILLSUMMARY: Requires the jury commissioner, every 6 months, to share with the county elections official for the same county the information that a potential juror provides about their qualification to be a juror and would further require a county elections official to use that information to cancel the registration of a person who is ineligible to vote.

BILLSUMMARY: Requires the Department of Motor Vehicles to transmit specified information to the Secretary of State with respect to a person who provides documentation demonstrating United States citizenship and that the person is of an eligible age to register or preregister to vote, among other requirements. Requires the county elections official to send a notice to a person if the Secretary of State changes the person's voter registration information after receiving updated name or address information.

HISTORY: ["02/18/2021 - INTRODUCED.","02/22/2021 - In SENATE. Article IV. Section 8(a) of the Constitution dispensed with.","02/22/2021 - In SENATE.  Joint Rule 55 suspended.","03/03/2021 - To SENATE Committee on RULES."]
BILLSUMMARY: States the intent of the Legislature to enact legislation that would mitigate issues surrounding the potential delay in the release of census data and the effect of that delay on local redistricting.

HISTORY: "02/01/2022 - In SENATE.  Returned to Secretary of Senate pursuant to Joint Rule 56."
BILLSUMMARY: Requires that the identification envelope include a verification panel, concealed during mailing, setting forth the last 4 digits of the voter's California driver's license or identification card number or, if unavailable, the last 4 digits of the voter's social security number. Requires the elections official to verify the accuracy of that information before counting the vote.

HISTORY: "02/01/2022 - In SENATE.  Returned to Secretary of Senate pursuant to Joint Rule 56."
BILLSUMMARY: Authorizes a voter to self-identify as having a disability for purposes of voting with a remote accessible vote by mail system. By increasing the duties of county elections officials.

BILLSUMMARY: Requires the secretary of state and county clerk and recorders of certain counties to provide multilingual ballot access, provides that the Secretary is required to establish a multilingual ballot hotline to provide access to qualified translators or interpreters in each of the languages in which the most recent decennial census was offered to assist electors in translating ballot language.

BILLSUMMARY: Expands automatic voter registration to certain state agencies, establishes automatic application for voter registration at certain state agencies that currently make available voter registration information, creates a presumption that any removal from a party enrollment list through such automatic application for voter registration was unintentional.

HISTORY: ["01/28/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/29/2021 - To JOINT Committee on GOVERNMENT ADMINISTRATION AND ELECTIONS.","02/10/2021 - Vote to Draft.","03/10/2021 - Drafted by Committee.","03/11/2021 - To JOINT Committee on GOVERNMENT ADMINISTRATION AND ELECTIONS.","03/12/2021 - Public Hearing Scheduled 0317.","04/05/2021 - From JOINT Committee on GOVERNMENT ADMINISTRATION AND ELECTIONS:  Reported with substitute.","04/06/2021 - Filed with Legislative Commissioner's Office.","04/16/2021 - Referred to Office of Legislative Research and Office of Fiscal Analysis.","04/22/2021 - Committee Substitute reported out of Legislative Commissioner's Office.","04/22/2021 - HOUSE Calendar No. 399.","04/22/2021 - Reissued by Legislative Commissioner's Office with File No. 572.","05/24/2021 - HOUSE adopted HOUSE Amendment Schedule A 8934.","05/24/2021 - HOUSE rejected HOUSE Amendment Schedule B 8915.","05/24/2021 - HOUSE rejected HOUSE Amendment Schedule C 8938.","05/24/2021 - Passed HOUSE.  *****To SENATE.","05/26/2021 - Senate Calendar No. 490.","05/26/2021 - Reissued by Legislative Commissioner's Office with File No. 724."]

BILLSUMMARY: Relates to elections and primaries generally, so as to provide that the name and designation of the precinct appears on every ballot, provides for the use of holographic security devices on ballots, provides for the storage and retention of absentee ballots by precinct with chain of custody, provides for the manner of handling and processing ballots requiring duplication for processing, provides for the maintenance of certain lists of absentee voters, provides for related matters.

BILLSUMMARY: Relates to voting, provides for automatic registration, provides that an application for voter registration shall be a part of the application for issuance of an identification card and a driver's license, provides that a qualified applicant for a new or renewed motor vehicle driver's license shall automatically be registered to vote with the clerk of the appropriate county upon completion of the driver's license application and application for voter registration.

BILLSUMMARY: Clarifies and improves the administration of elections by mail, establishes voters with special needs advisory committees, requires the Department of Public Safety and Hawaii paroling authority to inform individuals on parole or probation of their right to vote and provide them with information on how to register and vote, requires the Office of Elections and the county clerks to make a determination of the optimal number and placement of voter service centers, provides for minimum number of precincts.

BILLSUMMARY: Provides that the annual salaries of the executive and judicial branch shall be adjusted pursuant to the salary recommendations of the commission on salaries to the level, establishes public notice requirements for short form public notices of reapportionment plans, amends the start date for the availability of nomination papers for the 2022 Primary Election, relates to permanent residents, authorizes and appropriates funds to the reapportionment committee.

BILLSUMMARY: Proposes to amend Article IV of the Constitution of the state by inserting a new section that provides that, for the purposes of legislative reapportionment and redistricting, the term permanent resident means any person counted as residing in the state, according to the most recent census certified by the United States Census Bureau or any successor federal agency.

HISTORY: "03/16/2022 - In Committee: Measure Deferred."
BILLSUMMARY: Repeals the definition of permanent resident for legislative reapportionment purposes.

HISTORY: "03/16/2022 - In Committee: Measure Deferred."
BILLSUMMARY: Proposes a constitutional amendment to specify that reapportionment shall be based on the resident population, as counted in the most recent decennial United States Census.

BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, provides that in distribution of the remaining funds received under the federal Help America Vote Act, the State Board of Elections may make such funds available to election authorities for the maintenance of secure collection sites for the return of vote by mail ballots, allows election authorities to establish curb-side voting for individuals to cast a ballot during Early voting or on election day.

HISTORY: "03/27/2021 - Rule 19(a)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, requires a county clerk or board of election commissioners to cross-check each voter registration roll with the national Change of Address System information gathered by the United States Postal Service to determine if the changed address of each person who has filed a change of address has resulted in the removal of that person from the voting precinct or voting election district in which he or she was enrolled as a voter.

HISTORY: "03/27/2021 - Rule 19(a)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, prohibits an election authority from administering a policy that permits the direct mailing of ballots to prospective voters without first the possession of valid applications of those voters, prohibits an election authority from administering a policy that includes the mass mailing of voter applications for an official ballot without such a policy being first approved by the electorate of that election authority's jurisdiction in a referendum.

HISTORY: "02/18/2022 - Rule 19(a)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: NA

HISTORY: "03/27/2021 - Rule 19(a)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: NA

HISTORY: "02/18/2022 - Rule 19(a)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, requires Voters Identification Cards for those who do not have an acceptable photo ID, sets forth requirements and exemptions, provides that any person desiring to vote shall present to the judges of election for verification of the person's identity a government-issued photo identification card or his or her Voter Identification Card.

HISTORY: "03/27/2021 - Rule 19(a)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, provides that the county board or board of county commissioners of a county with a population of less than 100,000 may, by ordinance or resolution, dissolve a municipal board of election commissioners within that county and transfer its functions to the county clerk.

HISTORY: "03/27/2021 - Rule 19(a)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: NA

HISTORY: "03/27/2021 - Rule 19(a)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, allows the State Board of Elections to access a landlord's tenant information by paying the landlord a fee to verify a person's address for voter registration, provides that the State Board of Elections shall adopt rules as necessary to implement the provisions and disclose the information to the appropriate election authorities as needed.

HISTORY: "03/27/2021 - Rule 19(a)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, requires a vote by mail ballot to be postmarked 3 days before election day to be counted, requires a ballot that is mailed using an intelligent mail barcode tracking system to an election authority absent a postmark be counted if the intelligent mail barcode tracking system verifies the envelope was mailed no later than 3 days before election day, makes conforming changes throughout the Code.

HISTORY: "03/27/2021 - Rule 19(a)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: NA

HISTORY: "03/27/2021 - Rule 19(a)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, provides that the State Board of Elections shall create a policy to be instituted by each election authority concerning the chain of custody and secure storage of vote by mail ballots.

HISTORY: "03/27/2021 - Rule 19(a)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: NA

HISTORY: "03/27/2021 - Rule 19(a)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, requires Voters Identification Cards for those who do not have an acceptable photo ID, sets forth requirements and exemptions, provides that any person desiring to vote shall present to the judges of election for verification of the person's identity a government-issued photo identification card or his or her Voter Identification Card.

BILLSUMMARY: Requires the Department of Corrections to give a person, prior to discharge, an opportunity to apply for health care coverage, information about obtaining an Illinois Identification Card or a limited term Illinois Identification, information about voter registration, information about job listings and housing, a directory of elected state officials and of officials elected in the county and municipality in which the committed person intends to reside, and other information the Department deems necessary.

HISTORY: "05/29/2021 - Rule 3-9(a) / Re-referred to ASSIGNMENTS Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Address Confidentiality for Victims of Domestic Violence, Sexual Assault, or Stalking Act, changes the name of the act to the Address Confidentiality for Victims of Domestic Violence, Sexual Assault, Human Trafficking, or Stalking Act, makes the act's requirements applicable to victims of human trafficking.

HISTORY: ["02/19/2021 - INTRODUCED.","02/19/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on RULES.","03/16/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on ETHICS & ELECTIONS.","03/27/2021 - Rule 19(a)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."]
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, allows an elector to be added to a list of permanent vote by mail status voters who receive an official vote by mail ballot for all subsequent elections, provides that a voter whose application for permanent vote by mail status is accepted by the election authority shall remain on the permanent vote by mail list until the voter requests to be removed from permanent vote by mail status, the voter provides notice to the election authority of a change in registration.

HISTORY: "03/27/2021 - Rule 19(a)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, provides that the State Board of Elections shall establish by rule a system for the publication and certification of elections results to be used by all election authorities, provides that the county clerk of the county where a decedent last resided shall issue certifications of death records from an electronic reporting system for death registrations as provided in the Vital Records Act and shall use that system to cancel the registration of any person who died.

HISTORY: "03/27/2021 - Rule 19(a)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, provides that the state Board of Elections shall work with election authorities and the disability community to develop and implement procedures and technologies to provide vote by mail ballots, upon request, in alternative formats that allow all voters to cast a secret, independent, and verifiable vote by mail ballot without the assistance of another person, requires the procedures and technologies to include an accessible electronic ballot marking tool that enables voters.

HISTORY: ["02/19/2021 - INTRODUCED.","02/22/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on RULES.","03/16/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on ETHICS & ELECTIONS.","03/27/2021 - Rule 19(a)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."]
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, creates a permanent vote by mail list for qualified voters, allows a voter to apply to be placed on a permanent vote by mail list to receive vote by mail ballots for subsequent elections, provides for the removal of a voter from the permanent vote by mail list who does not return a vote by mail ballot for the fourth general election following the general election at which the voter last voted, allows for a voter on the permanent vote by mail list to choose.

HISTORY: "03/27/2021 - Rule 19(a)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Voting Rights Act, provides that no later than specified date of the year immediately following the federal decennial census, the General Assembly shall establish a Special Joint-House and Senate Redistricting Committee to develop and finalize a redistricting plan for Legislative Districts and Representative Districts, provides that the Committee shall consist of 12 members appointed by the General Assembly, provides the priorities and requirements for Legislative Districts.

HISTORY: "02/18/2022 - Rule 19(a)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: NA

HISTORY: "04/23/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on RULES."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, creates the Rights of Voters Article, prohibits the imposition or application of a voting qualification or prerequisite to voting or standard, practice, or procedure by the State or any locality in a manner that results in a denial or abridgement of the right of any citizen of the United States to vote based on race or color or membership in a language minority group, provides that a county, city, or town that has more than 5% of its eligible voters or 10,000 eligible voters.

HISTORY: "09/03/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on RULES."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, provides that each election precinct shall contain 1,200 voters, makes corresponding and other changes, removes, in provisions concerning the county board of a county with less than 3,000,000 inhabitants, language providing that an election precinct with more than 600 voters may be divided, provides that a county board may at specified meetings, redivide, consolidate, or readjust election precincts to meet the 1,200 voters per precinct standard.

HISTORY: "02/18/2022 - Rule 19(a)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, provides that the State Police and State Board of Elections shall establish an automatic voter registration program that allows an application for, application for renewal of, or change of address form for a Firearm Owner's Identification Card or a concealed carry license to serve as a dual-purpose application to register to vote in, change his or her registered residence address or name as it appears on the voter registration rolls, affirmatively decline to register to vote.

HISTORY: "02/18/2022 - Rule 19(a)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: NA

HISTORY: "02/18/2022 - Rule 19(a)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, allows the State Board of Elections to receive voter registration information provided by applicants using electronic voter registration portals, provides that, notwithstanding any other provision of law, a person who is otherwise qualified to vote may preregister to vote on or after their 16th birthday, with the registration held in abeyance by the appropriate election authority until that individual attains the required age to vote, provides for preregistration.

HISTORY: "02/18/2022 - Rule 19(a)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Creates the Twentieth Judicial Circuit Districting Act, provides that on a specified date, the Twentieth Judicial Circuit is divided into 3 subcircuits, provides descriptions of each subcircuit, provides for the assignment of existing circuit judgeships to subcircuits by the Supreme Court.

HISTORY: "01/21/2022 - To HOUSE Committee on RULES."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, provides that the State Board of Elections shall create a policy to be instituted by each election authority concerning the chain of custody and secure storage of vote by mail ballots, provides that the policy shall include the procedures to destroy a ballot if a voter returns a vote by mail ballot and votes in person at the same election, reports requirements of the number of vote by mail ballots received, rejected, or destroyed due to in person voting.

HISTORY: "01/21/2022 - To HOUSE Committee on RULES."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, requires Voter Identification Cards for those who do not have an acceptable photo ID, sets forth requirements and exemptions, provides that any person desiring to vote shall present to the judges of election for verification of the person's identity a government-issued photo identification card or his or her Voter Identification Card.

HISTORY: "01/21/2022 - To HOUSE Committee on RULES."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, provides that the State Board of Elections shall develop procedures for conducting audits of affidavit signatures on ballots cast in each regular election, provides that each election authority shall select at random a certain percent of the ballots cast within the jurisdiction of the election authority to be audited in accordance with the those procedures.

HISTORY: "01/21/2022 - To HOUSE Committee on RULES."
BILLSUMMARY: NA

HISTORY: "01/21/2022 - To HOUSE Committee on RULES."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, provides that the county clerk of a county where a decedent last resided shall issue certifications of death records from the electronic reporting system for death registrations and shall use that system to cancel the registration of any person who has died during the preceding month, establishes requirements for a county coroner, medical examiner, or physician for a county or any other individual responsible for certification of death under the Vital Records Act.

HISTORY: "01/21/2022 - To HOUSE Committee on RULES."
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to a requirement that election authorities automatically register a voter, requires the authority to act within a certain number of days of receipt of information from the national change of address database, requires county clerks and the board of election commissioners to complete verifications of voter registrations after a consolidated election in an odd-numbered year but before the first day of candidate circulation for candidate filing for the following primary election.

HISTORY: "02/18/2022 - Rule 19(a)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: NA

HISTORY: "01/27/2022 - To HOUSE Committee on RULES."
BILLSUMMARY: NA

HISTORY: "02/18/2022 - Rule 19(a)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, provides that the period for early voting by personal appearance begins a specified day preceding a general primary, consolidated primary, consolidated, or general election and extends through the end of the day the Friday immediately preceding election day.

HISTORY: "02/18/2022 - Rule 19(a)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: NA

HISTORY: "02/18/2022 - Rule 19(a)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, provides that voting by physically incapacitated electors who have made proper application to the election authority not later than 5 days before the regular primary and general election shall be conducted either through vote by mail procedures or on specified premises.

HISTORY: "02/18/2022 - Rule 19(a)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: NA

HISTORY: "02/18/2022 - Rule 19(a)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, provides that, except for in a county with a population of at least 3,000,000 or where election judges are selected by election commissioners, an election authority may reduce the number of judges of election in each precinct from 5 to 3 for any election, provides that, in certain cities, villages, and incorporated towns with a board of election commissioners, the board shall select and choose no less than 3 persons as judges of election for each precinct.

HISTORY: "02/18/2022 - Rule 19(a)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, provides that an election authority establishing a vote center under the Section shall identify the location, hours of operation, and any health and safety requirements by the 40th day preceding an election and certify such to the State Board of Elections, removes a repeal date of January 1, 2023 for the vote center provisions.

HISTORY: "02/18/2022 - Rule 19(a)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, provides that an election authority does not need to notify a voter by mail before a general election if the voter applied for permanent vote by mail status or the voter submitted a written request to be excluded from the permanent vote by mail status.

HISTORY: ["01/27/2022 - INTRODUCED.","01/27/2022 - To HOUSE Committee on RULES."]
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Elections Code, creates the Election Integrity Task Force to evaluate the integrity of the voting systems in, requires appointment of specified members no later than 30 days after the effective date of the amendatory Act, provides that the Task Force shall review and recommend changes to election law and procedures to protect the integrity of the elections, provides that the Task Force shall conduct a comprehensive review of: the security of the vote before, during, and after election day.

HISTORY: "02/18/2022 - Rule 19(a)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, provides that collection sites for vote by mail ballots shall be established only on the grounds of a public building where normal business of a unit of local government is conducted and the building does not have a residential component, provides that those collection sites shall be recorded by security cameras, and the recordings shall be retained by the election authority for a period of 90-days after each election.

HISTORY: "02/18/2022 - Rule 19(a)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, makes changes to identification requirements for certain applications with the Secretary of State to serve as a dual-purpose application, provides that if an applicant provides the Secretary of State with an identification document demonstrating a lack of United States citizenship, the application shall not serve as a dual-purpose application.

HISTORY: "02/18/2022 - Rule 19(a)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, provides that the State Board of Elections shall establish by rule a system for the publication and certification of elections results to be used by all election authorities, provides that the county clerk of the county where a decedent last resided shall issue certifications of death records from an electronic reporting system for death registrations as provided in the Vital Records Act and shall use that system to cancel the registration of any person who died.

HISTORY: "08/01/2022 - INTRODUCED."
BILLSUMMARY: NA

HISTORY: ["01/05/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/08/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on RULES.","01/13/2021 - HOUSE Session Sine Die."]
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Redistricting Transparency and Public Participation Act, creates the Independent Redistricting Commission to adopt and file with the Secretary of State a redistricting plan for Legislative and Representative Districts, provides the commissioner selection process and meeting and voting requirements to adopt a plan, makes conforming changes in the Act.

HISTORY: "07/18/2021 - Rule 19(b)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Proposes to amend the Legislature Article of the Constitution, provides that if a municipality has been divided between two or more Legislative Districts under a redistricting plan, that municipality may petition to the General Assembly, or the Commission established by the General Assembly, to unify the municipality into one Legislative District.

HISTORY: "07/18/2021 - Rule 19(b)/ Re-referred to RULES Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: NA

BILLSUMMARY: Sets forth redistricting principles, the hearing process, and summaries of Representative Districts with respect to the 2021 General Assembly Redistricting Plan.

BILLSUMMARY: Sets forth redistricting principles, the hearing process, and summaries of Legislative Districts with respect to the 2021 General Assembly Redistricting Plan.

BILLSUMMARY: Relates to the Freedom of Information Act, amends the Address Confidentiality for Victims of Domestic Violence, Sexual Assault, or Stalking Act, relates to voter registration forms, prohibits the name or address of a program participant under that Act from being included in any list of registered voters available to the public.

BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, relates to cybersecurity, requires each election authority maintaining a website to begin utilizing a .gov website address and a .gov electronic mail address for each employee.

BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, provides that each election precinct shall contain 1,200 voters, makes corresponding and other changes, in provisions concerning the county board of a county with less than 3,000,000 inhabitants, removes language providing that an election precinct with more than 600 voters may be divided, provides that a county board may at specified meetings, redivide, consolidate, or readjust election precincts to meet the 1,200 voters per precinct standard.

HISTORY: ["02/26/2021 - INTRODUCED.","02/26/2021 - To SENATE Committee on ASSIGNMENTS.","03/09/2021 - To SENATE Committee on EXECUTIVE.","03/17/2021 - In SENATE Committee on EXECUTIVE:  To Executive-Elections.","04/16/2021 - Rule 3-9(a) / Re-referred to ASSIGNMENTS Committee."]

HISTORY: ["02/26/2021 - INTRODUCED.","02/26/2021 - To SENATE Committee on ASSIGNMENTS."]
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Counties Code, provides that, in a county where the chairman of the county board or county executive is elected by the voters of the county, should there be a delay in the availability of the census data, the chairman of the county board or county executive may develop and present the decennial apportionment plan to the board within 6 months following availability of the data, makes conforming changes.

HISTORY: "04/16/2021 - Rule 3-9(a) / Re-referred to ASSIGNMENTS Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, provides that in provisions requiring the Governor to appoint 2 members to the State Board of Elections from a list of nominees submitted by certain state executive officers from the opposing political party as the Governor, when all state executive officers are affiliated with the same political party as the Governor, the highest ranking State Senator of the political party not affiliated with the Governor shall be considered the nominating State officer.

BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, requires the state Board of Elections to adopt rules establishing a procedure to send vote by mail ballots via electronic transmission and enable a voter with a disability to independently and privately mark a ballot using assistive technology in order for the voter to vote by mail.

BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Re Entering Citizens Civics Education Act, expands the program to persons committed to a Department of Juvenile Justice facility, provides that the workshop held at the Department of Juvenile Justice shall consist of a specified number of minutes of instruction, provides that the civil education program in the Department of Juvenile Justice shall be taught by two co facilitators, relates to voting rights and registration peer education program, provides for funding.

HISTORY: "04/16/2021 - Rule 3-9(a) / Re-referred to ASSIGNMENTS Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, requires the State Board of Elections, in conjunction with election authorities, to implement a secure, free access system available to voters by January 1, 2023, provides that the system shall allow a voter to track receipt of his or her vote by mail ballot and check the ballot's status with the election authority.

HISTORY: "04/16/2021 - Rule 3-9(a) / Re-referred to ASSIGNMENTS Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, allows the State Board of Elections to receive voter registration information provided by applicants using electronic voter registration portals, provides that notwithstanding any other provision of law, a person who is otherwise qualified to vote may preregister to vote on or after that person's 16th birthday, with the registration held in abeyance by the appropriate election authority until that individual attains the required age to vote.

HISTORY: ["02/26/2021 - INTRODUCED.","02/26/2021 - To SENATE Committee on ASSIGNMENTS.","04/07/2021 - To SENATE Committee on EXECUTIVE.","04/15/2021 - In SENATE Committee on EXECUTIVE:  To Executive-Elections.","04/16/2021 - Rule 3-9(a) / Re-referred to ASSIGNMENTS Committee."]
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, changes the definition of person with a disability to include a person having an intellectual or developmental disability, makes conforming changes throughout the Code, requires an election authority to provide public notice 75 days before each general and consolidated election calculated to reach elderly voters and voters with disabilities, of the availability of registration and voting aids under the Federal Voting Accessibility for the Elderly and Handicapped Act.

HISTORY: "04/16/2021 - Rule 3-9(a) / Re-referred to ASSIGNMENTS Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: NA

HISTORY: "04/16/2021 - Rule 3-9(a) / Re-referred to ASSIGNMENTS Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: NA

HISTORY: "02/26/2021 - To SENATE Committee on ASSIGNMENTS."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Voting Rights Act, provides that no later than January 31st of the year immediately following the federal decennial census, the General Assembly shall establish a Special Joint-House and Senate Redistricting Committee to develop and finalize a redistricting plan for Legislative Districts and Representative Districts, provides that the Committee shall consist of 12 members appointed by the General Assembly, provides the priorities and requirements for Legislative Districts and Representative.

HISTORY: ["02/26/2021 - INTRODUCED.","02/26/2021 - To SENATE Committee on ASSIGNMENTS.","04/07/2021 - To SENATE Committee on EXECUTIVE.","04/16/2021 - Rule 3-9(a) / Re-referred to ASSIGNMENTS Committee."]
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, creates a permanent vote by mail list for qualified voters, allows a voter to apply to be placed on a permanent vote by mail list to receive vote by mail ballots for subsequent elections, provides for the removal of a voter from the permanent vote by mail list who does not return a vote by mail ballot for certain elections, allows for a voter on the permanent vote by mail list to choose and change political party preferences for a primary vote by mail ballot.

HISTORY: "04/16/2021 - Rule 3-9(a) / Re-referred to ASSIGNMENTS Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: NA

BILLSUMMARY: Creates the Cook County Board of Review Redistricting Act of 2021, redistricts Cook County for election of Cook County Board of Review Commissioners, repeals the Cook County Board of Review Districts Act and the Cook County Board of Review Districts Act of 2001, amends the Property Tax Code, provides that in certain years, the General Assembly may use other population data, including, but not limited to, the most recent American Community Survey 5-year data, to reapportion board of review districts.

HISTORY: "02/10/2022 - Rule 3-9(a) / Re-referred to ASSIGNMENTS Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Criminal Code of 2012, provides that a person commits aggravated assault when, in committing an assault, he or she knows the individual assaulted to be a judge of election performs his or her official duties, is assaulted to prevent performance of his or her official duties, or assaulted in retaliation for performing his or her official duties, provides that the penalty is a Class 4 felony, provides for when a person commits aggravated battery.

HISTORY: ["10/26/2021 - INTRODUCED.","10/26/2021 - To SENATE Committee on ASSIGNMENTS."]
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, provides that the county clerk of a county where a decedent last resided shall issue certifications of death records from the electronic reporting system for death registrations and shall use that system to cancel the registration of any person who has died during the preceding month, requires a county coroner, medical examiner, or physician for a county or any other individual responsible for certification of death under the Vital Records Act.

HISTORY: ["10/26/2021 - INTRODUCED.","10/26/2021 - To SENATE Committee on ASSIGNMENTS."]
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, provides that the State Board of Elections shall develop and maintain a statewide or locally-based system to track and confirm when there is a change in the status of a trackable ballot, provides that the term trackable ballot means a ballot that is: mailed to a voter, deposited in the mail, or deposited in a ballot box.

HISTORY: ["10/26/2021 - INTRODUCED.","10/26/2021 - To SENATE Committee on ASSIGNMENTS."]
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, requires Voter Identification Cards for those who do not have an acceptable photo id, sets forth requirements and exemptions, provides that any person desiring to vote shall present to the judges of election for verification of the person's identity a government-issued photo identification card or his or her Voter Identification Card.

HISTORY: ["01/05/2022 - INTRODUCED.","01/05/2022 - To SENATE Committee on ASSIGNMENTS."]
BILLSUMMARY: NA

HISTORY: ["01/05/2022 - INTRODUCED.","01/05/2022 - To SENATE Committee on ASSIGNMENTS."]
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, provides that the State Board of Elections shall develop and maintain a statewide or locally-based system to track and confirm when there is a change in the status of a trackable ballot, provides that the term trackable ballot means a ballot that is: mailed to a voter, deposited in the mail by a voter, or deposited in a ballot box by a voter.

HISTORY: ["01/05/2022 - INTRODUCED.","01/05/2022 - To SENATE Committee on ASSIGNMENTS."]
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, provides that the county clerk of a county where a decedent last resided shall issue certifications of death records from the electronic reporting system for death registrations and shall use that system to cancel the registration of any person who has died during the preceding month, requires a county coroner, medical examiner, or physician for a county or any other individual responsible for certification of death under the Vital Records Act.

HISTORY: ["01/05/2022 - INTRODUCED.","01/05/2022 - To SENATE Committee on ASSIGNMENTS."]
BILLSUMMARY: NA

HISTORY: ["02/10/2022 - Rule 3-9(a) / Re-referred to ASSIGNMENTS Committee.","02/10/2022 - Rule 3-9(a) / Senate Committee Amendment No. 1 Re-referred to ASSIGNMENTS Committee."]
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, makes changes to identification requirements for certain applications with the Secretary of State to serve as a dual-purpose application, provides that if an applicant provides the Secretary of State with an identification document demonstrating a lack of United States citizenship, the application shall not serve as a dual-purpose application.

HISTORY: "02/10/2022 - Rule 3-9(a) / Re-referred to ASSIGNMENTS Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, allows the state Board of Elections to receive voter registration information provided by applicants using electronic voter registration portals, provides that, notwithstanding any other provision of law, a person who is otherwise qualified to vote may preregister to vote on or after their 16th birthday, with the registration held in abeyance by the appropriate election authority until that individual attains the required age to vote.

HISTORY: ["01/21/2022 - INTRODUCED.","01/21/2022 - To SENATE Committee on ASSIGNMENTS."]
BILLSUMMARY: NA

HISTORY: "02/10/2022 - Rule 3-9(a) / Re-referred to ASSIGNMENTS Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, provides that an election authority establishing a vote center under the section shall identify the location, hours of operation, and any health and safety requirements by the 40th day preceding an election and certify such to the state Board of Elections, removes a repeal date for the vote center provisions.

HISTORY: "02/10/2022 - Rule 3-9(a) / Re-referred to ASSIGNMENTS Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, provides that an election authority does not need to notify a voter by mail before a general election if the voter applied for permanent vote by mail status or the voter submitted a written request to be excluded from the permanent vote by mail status.

HISTORY: "02/10/2022 - Rule 3-9(a) / Re-referred to ASSIGNMENTS Committee."
BILLSUMMARY: NA

HISTORY: ["01/21/2022 - INTRODUCED.","01/21/2022 - To SENATE Committee on ASSIGNMENTS."]
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Election Code, modifies requirements for the registration record card and registration oath, changes some references to computer tapes or computer discs or other electronic data processing information containing voter registration information to voter registration data, provides that voter registration records or data shall not be used for any personal, private, or commercial purposes, including specified examples, provides for criminal penalties for specified unlawful uses.

HISTORY: ["01/14/2022 - INTRODUCED.","01/14/2022 - To SENATE Committee on ASSIGNMENTS."]
BILLSUMMARY: NA

HISTORY: ["08/31/2021 - INTRODUCED.","08/31/2021 - To SENATE Committee on ASSIGNMENTS.","08/31/2021 - From SENATE Committee on ASSIGNMENTS: Approved for Consideration.","08/31/2021 - In SENATE.  Placed on Calendar Order of Resolutions.","08/31/2021 - In SENATE.  Passed SENATE."]
BILLSUMMARY: Sets forth redistricting principles, the hearing process, and summaries of Legislative Districts with respect to the 2021 General Assembly Redistricting Plan.

Referred to ASSIGNMENTS.","05/28/2021 - From SENATE Committee on ASSIGNMENTS:  Approved for consideration-Amendment No. 1.","05/28/2021 - In SENATE.  Read second time. BILLSUMMARY: Sets forth redistricting principles, the hearing process, and summaries of Legislative Districts with respect to the 2021 General Assembly Redistricting Plan, makes grammatical and other corrections.

HISTORY: ["01/05/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/05/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on ELECTIONS AND APPORTIONMENT."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to vote by mail, requires that all elections be conducted by mail beginning with elections in 2024, provides for the specified date, expiration of several provisions of the election code that will be obsolete under a vote by mail system, requires the interim study committee on elections to study the transition to a vote by mail system and propose necessary legislation to accomplish the transition.

HISTORY: ["01/05/2022 - INTRODUCED.","01/05/2022 - To HOUSE Committee on ELECTIONS AND APPORTIONMENT."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to automatic voter registration, provides that an application to obtain or renew a motor vehicle driver's license or permit or an identification card serves as a voter registration application unless the applicant expressly declines on the application to register to vote, provides that a voter becomes registered to vote when the county voter registration office determines the voter appears to be eligible to vote at the address on the voter's voter registration application.

HISTORY: ["01/18/2022 - From HOUSE Committee on ELECTIONS AND APPORTIONMENT:  Do pass as amended.","01/18/2022 - Committee amendment adopted on HOUSE floor.","01/18/2022 - To HOUSE Committee on WAYS AND MEANS."]
BILLSUMMARY: Provides that the security agreement that counties are required to enter into with the Secretary of State must be funded by money received from the federal government or from money appropriated by the general assembly, provides requirements before an individual can access an absentee ballot application that is submitted in an electronic format using a module of the computerized list.

HISTORY: ["01/05/2022 - INTRODUCED.","01/05/2022 - To HOUSE Committee on ELECTIONS AND APPORTIONMENT."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to absentee voting, requires all absentee ballot applications sent by an entity other than the county clerk's office to have a disclaimer that the application was sent unsolicited and to list the organization responsible for sending the application, provides that an agency of the state or a political subdivision may not provide an individual with an application for an absentee ballot unless requested by the individual, provides that an absentee ballot application.

HISTORY: ["01/08/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/08/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on ELECTIONS AND APPORTIONMENT."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to vote centers, requires that a vote center county must establish at least one vote center in each municipality located in the county.
NA

HISTORY: ["01/08/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/14/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on ELECTIONS AND APPORTIONMENT."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to Commission on Election Integrity, establishes the Commission on Election Integrity, requires the commission to consider various means by which to increase the integrity of elections in the State, requires the commission to submit a report to the legislative council, including recommendations for legislation, not later than a specified date, provides that the statute expires on a specified date.

HISTORY: ["01/08/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/08/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on ELECTIONS AND APPORTIONMENT."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to Same Day Registration, permits a voter to register at the polls by completing a voter registration form and an affirmation that the individual has not voted elsewhere in the election and by providing proof of residence, requires the ballot of a voter who registers at the polls to be treated as a provisional ballot.

HISTORY: ["01/11/2022 - INTRODUCED.","01/11/2022 - To HOUSE Committee on EDUCATION."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to various election law matters, prohibits the State election commission from instituting, increasing, or expanding vote by mail or absentee vote by mail, and changing the time, place, or manner of holding an election, prohibits a person from providing an absentee ballot application with the driver's license number or last four digits of the voter's Social Security number already printed on the form.

HISTORY: ["01/11/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/11/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on ELECTIONS AND APPORTIONMENT."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to automatic voter registration, provides that an application to obtain or renew a motor vehicle driver's license or permit or an identification card serves as a voter registration application unless the applicant expressly declines on the application to register to vote, provides that a voter becomes registered to vote when the county voter registration office determines the voter appears to be eligible to vote at the address on the voter's voter registration application.

HISTORY: ["01/11/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/11/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on ELECTIONS AND APPORTIONMENT.","02/11/2021 - From HOUSE Committee on ELECTIONS AND APPORTIONMENT:  Do pass as amended.","02/11/2021 - Committee amendment adopted on HOUSE floor.","02/17/2021 - Ordered Engrossed.","02/22/2021 - Passed HOUSE.  *****To SENATE.","03/01/2021 - To SENATE Committee on ELECTIONS.","03/15/2021 - From SENATE Committee on ELECTIONS:  Do pass."]
BILLSUMMARY: Provides that the rules in existence for counting straight ticket votes apply to ballots cast on electronic voting systems and that the current rules apply to paper ballots and optical scan ballots, requires the county election board to begin entering unofficial results canvassed by the county election board into the computerized list for statewide and legislative offices on election night and continuing at stated intervals through the day after election day until the entry of unofficial results.

HISTORY: ["01/11/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/11/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on ELECTIONS AND APPORTIONMENT."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to voter registration, permits a voter to register at the polls by completing a voter registration form and an affirmation that the person has not voted elsewhere in the election and by providing proof of residence, provides that the voter registration period in a general or municipal election continues up until the day before the general or municipal election.

HISTORY: ["01/11/2022 - INTRODUCED.","01/11/2022 - To HOUSE Committee on ELECTIONS AND APPORTIONMENT."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to poll hours, provides that the polls close at 8 p.m., permits a voter to register at the polls by completing a voter registration form and an affirmation that the person has not voted elsewhere in the election and by providing proof of residence.

HISTORY: ["01/11/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/11/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on ELECTIONS AND APPORTIONMENT.","02/02/2021 - From HOUSE Committee on ELECTIONS AND APPORTIONMENT:  Do pass as amended.","02/02/2021 - Committee amendment adopted on HOUSE floor.","02/04/2021 - Ordered Engrossed.","02/08/2021 - Passed HOUSE.  *****To SENATE.","02/23/2021 - To SENATE Committee on ELECTIONS.","03/15/2021 - From SENATE Committee on ELECTIONS:  Do pass as amended.","03/15/2021 - Committee amendment adopted on SENATE floor.","03/23/2021 - Amended on SENATE floor.","03/23/2021 - Ordered Engrossed.","03/29/2021 - Passed SENATE.  *****To HOUSE for concurrence.","04/06/2021 - HOUSE refused to concur in SENATE amendments.","04/06/2021 - *****To CONFERENCE Committee.","04/21/2021 - CONFERENCE Committee Report adopted by HOUSE.","04/21/2021 - CONFERENCE Committee Report adopted by SENATE.","04/25/2021 - Eligible for GOVERNOR'S desk.","04/28/2021 - *****To GOVERNOR.","04/29/2021 - Signed by GOVERNOR.","04/29/2021 - Public Law No. 193-2021"]
BILLSUMMARY: Concerns elections, defines terms, requires the entry of filing information concerning all candidates into the statewide voter registration system, requires election certification documents to be filed only through the statewide voter registration system, requires that an absentee ballot application requesting that an absentee ballot be sent by mail or by traveling board submitted to a county using the statewide voter registration system must include a telephone number to contact the applicant.

HISTORY: ["01/12/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/12/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on ELECTIONS AND APPORTIONMENT."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to student identification card, requires each approved postsecondary educational institution to issue to each of its students a student id card that contains all the information on the card that makes the card an acceptable proof of identification under the State election law.

HISTORY: ["01/13/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/13/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on ELECTIONS AND APPORTIONMENT."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to processing absentee ballots, provides that absentee ballots may be scanned, but not tabulated, before election day, provides that a person who knowingly provides any other person with information concerning the number of votes a candidate received for an office or cast to approve or reject a public question on absentee ballots under the statute permitting scanning of absentee ballots before the closing of the polls commits a Level 6 felony, provides that every county may use machines.

HISTORY: ["01/13/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/13/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on ELECTIONS AND APPORTIONMENT.","02/01/2021 - From HOUSE Committee on ELECTIONS AND APPORTIONMENT:  Do pass.","02/04/2021 - Ordered Engrossed.","02/08/2021 - Passed HOUSE.  *****To SENATE.","02/23/2021 - To SENATE Committee on ELECTIONS.","03/15/2021 - From SENATE Committee on ELECTIONS:  Do pass as amended.","03/15/2021 - Committee amendment adopted on SENATE floor.","03/22/2021 - Ordered Engrossed.","03/23/2021 - Passed SENATE.  *****To HOUSE for concurrence.","04/05/2021 - HOUSE concurred in SENATE amendments.","04/11/2021 - Eligible for GOVERNOR'S desk.","04/23/2021 - *****To GOVERNOR.","04/23/2021 - Signed by GOVERNOR.","04/23/2021 - Public Law No. 118-2021"]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to early voting, provides that the county election board may adopt a resolution authorizing the circuit court clerk to establish a satellite office to permit voters to cast absentee ballots for at least four hours on the third Saturday preceding election day.

HISTORY: ["01/13/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/13/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on ELECTIONS AND APPORTIONMENT.","02/11/2021 - From HOUSE Committee on ELECTIONS AND APPORTIONMENT:  Do pass as amended.","02/11/2021 - Committee amendment adopted on HOUSE floor.","02/16/2021 - Ordered Engrossed.","02/18/2021 - Passed HOUSE.  *****To SENATE.","03/04/2021 - To SENATE Committee on ELECTIONS.","03/15/2021 - From SENATE Committee on ELECTIONS:  Do pass.","03/23/2021 - Amended on SENATE floor.","03/23/2021 - Ordered Engrossed.","03/25/2021 - Passed SENATE.  *****To HOUSE for concurrence.","04/13/2021 - HOUSE concurred in SENATE amendments.","04/19/2021 - Eligible for GOVERNOR'S desk.","04/28/2021 - *****To GOVERNOR.","04/29/2021 - Signed by GOVERNOR.","04/29/2021 - Public Law No. 209-2021"]
BILLSUMMARY: Defines breach of peace and law enforcement officer for purposes of election law, includes an identification document issued by a Native American Indian tribe or band for purposes of proof of identification, specifies to whom a watcher must report any violation of election laws, requires prior consent of an inspector for a watcher to object to any other precinct election officer concerning an alleged violation of election laws, allows for the removal and revocation of credentials.

HISTORY: ["01/13/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/13/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on ELECTIONS AND APPORTIONMENT."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to notice of polling locations, provides that a county election board shall do the following give not less than 21 days notice of the place of voting in each precinct by publication on the county's internet web site and in the local newspaper stating whether the polls are located in an accessible facility, the number of registered voters in the precinct, and the number of voting systems assigned to each facility.

HISTORY: ["01/14/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/14/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on RULES AND LEGISLATIVE PROCEDURES.","04/19/2021 - Reassigned to HOUSE Committee on ELECTIONS AND APPORTIONMENT.","09/22/2021 - Amended on HOUSE floor.","09/22/2021 - Ordered Engrossed.","09/23/2021 - Passed HOUSE.  *****To SENATE.","09/27/2021 - To SENATE Committee on ELECTIONS.","09/28/2021 - From SENATE Committee on ELECTIONS:  Do pass as amended.","09/28/2021 - Committee amendment adopted on SENATE floor.","09/30/2021 - Ordered Engrossed.","10/01/2021 - Passed SENATE.  *****To HOUSE for concurrence.","10/01/2021 - HOUSE concurred in SENATE amendments.","10/01/2021 - Eligible for GOVERNOR'S desk.","10/04/2021 - *****To GOVERNOR.","10/04/2021 - Signed by GOVERNOR.","10/06/2021 - Public Law No. 221-2021"]
BILLSUMMARY: Amends the Indiana Code concerning elections.

HISTORY: ["01/11/2022 - INTRODUCED.","01/11/2022 - To HOUSE Committee on ELECTIONS AND APPORTIONMENT."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to Redistricting Commission, requires the General Assembly to establish a commission to draw congressional and legislative districts not later than July 1, 2027, acknowledges that this proposed amendment has not been previously agreed to by a General Assembly.

HISTORY: ["12/28/2020 - PREFILED.","12/28/2020 - To SENATE Committee on ELECTIONS.","01/04/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/04/2021 - To SENATE Committee on ELECTIONS."]
BILLSUMMARY: Concerns vote centers, requires that a vote center county must establish at least one vote center in each municipality located in the county.

HISTORY: ["01/04/2022 - INTRODUCED.","01/04/2022 - To SENATE Committee on ELECTIONS."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to absentee voting for the elderly and disabled, provides that an elderly voter or a voter with disabilities may apply for permanent absentee voter status, provides that absentee ballots would be sent automatically to voters who have permanent absentee voter status.

HISTORY: ["01/06/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/06/2021 - To SENATE Committee on ELECTIONS."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to redistricting standards, establishes redistricting standards for congressional and state legislative districts, provides that the initial proposed plans for congressional and state legislative districts must comply with the redistricting standards, allows the general assembly, during the process by which the initial proposed plans become effective by being enacted as a law, to consider and adopt modifications to the initial proposed plans that deviate from the redistricting standards.

HISTORY: ["12/30/2020 - PREFILED.","12/30/2020 - To SENATE Committee on RULES AND LEGISLATIVE PROCEDURE.","01/04/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/04/2021 - To SENATE Committee on RULES AND LEGISLATIVE PROCEDURE.","01/25/2021 - From SENATE Committee on RULES AND LEGISLATIVE PROCEDURE:  Do pass as amended.","01/25/2021 - Committee amendment adopted on SENATE floor.","01/25/2021 - Reassigned to SENATE Committee on ELECTIONS."]
BILLSUMMARY: Permits a voter who is qualified to vote in person to vote by absentee ballot, removes all other qualifications for a voter to vote by absentee ballot except for a voter with disabilities who is unable to make a voting mark on the ballot or sign the absentee ballot secrecy envelope.
NA

HISTORY: ["01/06/2022 - INTRODUCED.","01/06/2022 - To SENATE Committee on ELECTIONS."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to absentee voting, permits a voter who is qualified to vote in person to vote by absentee ballot, removes all other qualifications for a voter to vote by absentee ballot except for a voter with disabilities who is unable to make a voting mark on the ballot or sign the absentee ballot secrecy envelope, makes conforming changes.

HISTORY: ["01/08/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/08/2021 - To SENATE Committee on ELECTIONS.","02/09/2021 - From SENATE Committee on ELECTIONS:  Do pass as amended.","02/09/2021 - Committee amendment adopted on SENATE floor.","02/11/2021 - Ordered Engrossed.","02/15/2021 - Passed SENATE.  *****To HOUSE.","03/02/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on ELECTIONS AND APPORTIONMENT.","03/18/2021 - From HOUSE Committee on ELECTIONS AND APPORTIONMENT:  Do pass as amended.","03/18/2021 - Committee amendment adopted on HOUSE floor.","03/22/2021 - Amended on HOUSE floor.","03/22/2021 - Ordered Engrossed.","03/23/2021 - Passed HOUSE.  *****To SENATE for concurrence.","04/01/2021 - SENATE concurred in HOUSE amendments.","04/11/2021 - Eligible for GOVERNOR'S desk.","04/23/2021 - *****To GOVERNOR.","04/23/2021 - Signed by GOVERNOR.","04/23/2021 - Public Law No. 108-2021"]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to circuit court clerk matters, allows a person who is 16 or 17 years of age to serve as a precinct election officer without the written approval of the school principal if school is not in session on election day, provides a method for a county to correct any errors or discrepancies in the boundary lines of precincts as depicted in information provided by the U.S. Bureau of the Census in conjunction with state redistricting, repeals an obsolete statute relating to establishing precincts.

HISTORY: ["01/11/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/11/2021 - To SENATE Committee on ELECTIONS."]
BILLSUMMARY: Establishes a Redistricting Commission to create, hold hearings on, take public comment about, and recommend plans to redraw general assembly districts and congressional districts, provides for the appointment of four commission members by the legislative leadership, establishes the redistricting commission nominating committee to receive applications from and evaluate applicants to fill the five remaining positions on the commission.

HISTORY: ["01/11/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/11/2021 - To SENATE Committee on ELECTIONS."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to Early voting, requires a county election board to establish at least one satellite office in the county for an election, requires a county to establish one additional satellite office in the county for each specified number of active voters in the county, requires that an absentee ballot marked and forwarded by a voter who subsequently dies be counted if the voter's name appears on the registration rolls for the precinct.

Divides the Commonwealth into Supreme Court Districts.

BILLSUMMARY: Provides for requesting a mail in absentee ballot by requesting an application from the county clerk or by requesting the ballot directly through a secure online portal, provides county clerks the option of tracking mail in absentee ballots by use of intelligent mail barcodes, establishes procedures for voters to return a mail in absentee ballot and vote in person.
Relates to county reapportionment and declares an emergency.

BILLSUMMARY: Proposes to automatically restore the voting rights of persons convicted of certain felonies upon completion of their imprisonment, probation, or parole and automatically restore their civil rights five years after completion of their imprisonment, probation, or parole, provides ballot language, submits to voters for ratification or rejection.

HISTORY: ["02/09/2021 - INTRODUCED.","02/09/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on COMMITTEES.","02/25/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on ELECTIONS, CONSTITUTIONAL AMENDMENTS AND INTERGOVERNMENTAL AFFAIRS."]
BILLSUMMARY: Allows a person who is homeless and lacks an established and fixed nighttime residence of regular return an option to choose a non-traditional place of residence for purposes of voting.

BILLSUMMARY: Proposes to allow persons convicted of certain felonies the right to vote, provides for ballots language included, submits to voters for ratification or rejection.

BILLSUMMARY: Creates new sections of KRS Chapters 116, 117, and 118 to define the term election, amends various sections of KRS Chapters 116, 117, 118, and 121 to require a runoff primary for two slates of candidates for Governor and Lieutenant Governor if the slates of candidates receive less than fifty percent of the votes cast for all slates of candidates of that party, permits in-person absentee voting for any qualified and registered voter for six working days including the two Saturdays.

BILLSUMMARY: Limits the effective dates of Executive Orders issued by the Governor unless an extension is approved by the General Assembly, prohibits the Governor from issuing a new Executive Order relating to the same emergency without the approval of the General Assembly.

HISTORY: ["01/21/2022 - Became law without GOVERNOR'S signature.","01/21/2022 - Act No. 9"]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to redistricting and declares an emergency.

HISTORY: ["01/20/2022 - GOVERNOR'S veto overridden by HOUSE.","01/20/2022 - GOVERNOR'S veto overridden by SENATE.","01/20/2022 - Act No. 8"]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to redistricting and declares an emergency.

Relates to legislative redistricting challenges, provides that an action challenging the constitutionality of any legislative district shall be brought in the Circuit Court of the county where the plaintiff resides, provides that the Secretary of State shall be named as a defendant in any action challenging the constitutionality of any legislative district, provides that the Legislative Research Commission may intervene in any action challenging the constitutionality of any legislative district.

BILLSUMMARY: Proposes to allow persons convicted of a felony, other than serious felonies designated by the General Assembly, the right to vote, and to further amend the constitution by replacing the language that prohibits idiots and insane persons from voting with contemporary language, ballots language included, submits to the voters for ratification or rejection.

HISTORY: ["02/22/2021 - INTRODUCED.","02/22/2021 - To SENATE Committee on COMMITTEES."]
BILLSUMMARY: Amends various sections of KRS Chapters 83A, 116, 117, 118, 118A, 119, 120, 242, and 424, relates to paper ballots, voting equipment, voting systems, consolidation of precincts, registration periods, inactive voters, penalties related to ballot harvesting, eligible precinct officers and work hours, early voting, online portal for mail-in absentee ballots, mail-in absentee drop-boxes, early counting of mail-in absentee ballots, ballot questions and advocacy.

HISTORY: ["02/22/2021 - INTRODUCED.","02/22/2021 - To SENATE Committee on COMMITTEES."]
BILLSUMMARY: Permits any qualified voter the ability to vote in-person absentee during normal business hours on at least any of the 12 working days and two Saturdays before an election, makes technical corrections.

HISTORY: ["02/22/2021 - INTRODUCED.","02/22/2021 - To SENATE Committee on COMMITTEES."]
BILLSUMMARY: Creates a new section of Chapter 117 to provide for the curing of certain mail-in absentee ballot deficiencies, allows for the combining of precincts into centralized voting locations with requirements prescribed, establishes an online portal to receive applications for mail-in absentee ballots, adds desire of voter as basis to request mail-in absentee ballot, establishes in-person Early voting, including two Saturdays.

HISTORY: ["02/23/2021 - INTRODUCED.","02/23/2021 - To SENATE Committee on COMMITTEES."]
BILLSUMMARY: Proposes to allow persons convicted of certain felonies the right to vote as provided by the General Assembly, includes ballots language, submits to voters for ratification or rejection.

BILLSUMMARY: Requires each voter to use a ballot marking device that is accessible to voters with disabilities to vote at early voting centers and election day polling places to ensure that access is provided to voters with disabilities in accordance with a certain provision of law, applies the Act to all elections beginning with the statewide primary election held under a certain provision of law in 2022.

HISTORY: ["01/15/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/15/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on WAYS AND MEANS.","01/18/2021 - Hearing Scheduled 2/02 at 1:30 p.m."]
BILLSUMMARY: Requires, in counties that have Fixed-Route Public Transportation Services, the Local Boards of Elections to give priority to placing ballot drop boxes at locations that are not more than 500 feet from a public transportation station or stop and designating polling places located not more than 500 feet from a public transportation station or stop, requires ballot drop boxes be placed in a manner that is accessible to voters with disabilities.

BILLSUMMARY: Requires a certain agent of a voter to be a family member or member of the voter's household to pick up and deliver the voter's absentee ballot, prohibits a certain campaign volunteer from being designated by a voter as a certain agent to pick up and deliver an absentee ballot, prohibits a certain agent of a voter from picking up and delivering more than three absentee ballots during each election.

HISTORY: ["01/26/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/26/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on WAYS AND MEANS.","01/28/2021 - Hearing Scheduled 2/09 at 1:30 p.m."]
BILLSUMMARY: Alters the circumstances under which an individual is not qualified to be a registered voter to include if the individual has been convicted of a certain violation of the election law and less than 4 years have elapsed since the date of the conviction, provides that a person who is convicted of a certain violation of the election law is ineligible to vote for a period of 4 years after the date of the conviction.

BILLSUMMARY: NA

BILLSUMMARY: Authorizes a local board of elections to take certain actions to prepare an absentee ballot for tabulation during the period beginning 14 days before election day through 8 p.m. on election day, prohibits a local board from tabulating absentee ballots before a certain time, alters a requirement that a local board prepare and release a report of the unofficial results of the absentee ballot tabulation at the end of the each day of canvassing to apply the requirement only to a certain period.

BILLSUMMARY: Repeals certain provisions of law governing the inclusion and counting of incarcerated individuals in the population count used after each decennial census for the purpose of creating congressional and certain legislative districting plans, repeals certain provisions of law requiring the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services to submit certain information for certain incarcerated individuals to the Maryland Department of Planning and the Department of Legislative Services.

BILLSUMMARY: Repeals a provision of law requiring a local board of elections to provide an absentee ballot by facsimile transmission if requested by a voter, alters a certain provision of law to require a local board to provide an absentee ballot by the Internet only if requested by certain voters, rather than to any voter on request.

HISTORY: ["02/11/2022 - Hearing cancelled.","02/11/2022 - Hearing Scheduled 3/08 at 1:00 p.m."]
BILLSUMMARY: NA

HISTORY: ["02/02/2021 - INTRODUCED.","02/02/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on RULES AND EXECUTIVE NOMINATIONS.","03/04/2021 - Hearing Scheduled 3/15 at 9:30 a.m."]
BILLSUMMARY: Proposes an amendment to the Maryland Constitution to require congressional districts consist of adjoining territory, be compact in form, and be of substantially equal population and that due regard be given to natural boundaries and the boundaries of political subdivisions, requires the amendment be submitted to the qualified voters of the State at the next general election to be held in November 2022 for adoption or rejection.

HISTORY: ["02/05/2021 - INTRODUCED.","02/05/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on WAYS AND MEANS.","02/10/2021 - Hearing Scheduled 2/23 at 1:30 p.m."]
BILLSUMMARY: Alters the number of Early voting centers required in certain counties.

HISTORY: ["02/05/2021 - INTRODUCED.","02/05/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on WAYS AND MEANS.","02/10/2021 - Hearing Scheduled 2/23 at 1:30 p.m.","02/10/2021 - Hearing cancelled.","02/10/2021 - Hearing Scheduled 3/09 at 1:30 p.m."]
BILLSUMMARY: Provides that voters are eligible for curbside voting under certain circumstances, requires that curbside voting be made available to all registered voters with disabilities recognized under a certain Federal Law, requires each local board of elections to establish a location outside each polling place for curbside voting, requires that a curbside voting location meet certain requirements.

HISTORY: ["02/05/2021 - INTRODUCED.","02/05/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on WAYS AND MEANS.","02/10/2021 - Hearing Scheduled 2/23 at 1:30 p.m.","02/10/2021 - Hearing cancelled.","02/10/2021 - Hearing Scheduled 3/09 at 1:30 p.m."]
BILLSUMMARY: Alters the membership of the State Board of Elections, requires certain members of the State Board to have expertise or experience in certain areas, provides for a nonvoting, ex officio member of the State Board, alters the duties of the State Board to include reviewing and voting on certain contracts and ensuring the cost effectiveness of the use of certain funds, requires the State Administrator of Elections to report contracts, contract renewals, and change orders to the State Board.

BILLSUMMARY: Requires that certain guidelines for absentee voting provide for voter access to information concerning the status of the voter's absentee ballot, requires the State Board of Elections to ensure that ballot drop boxes are available during a certain period before each election, requires the State Board to make at least 300 ballot drop boxes available for certain elections, requires the State Board to establish a certain formula for the purpose of allocating ballot drop boxes among the counties.

BILLSUMMARY: Requires that certain guidelines for absentee voting established by the State Board of Elections provide for a permanent absentee ballot list, provides that all voters are eligible for permanent absentee ballot status, requires a voter to complete and submit certain information to apply for permanent absentee ballot status, prohibits a voter who has applied for permanent absentee ballot status from receiving an absentee ballot for the next election if the application is made after a certain deadline.

HISTORY: ["02/05/2021 - INTRODUCED.","02/05/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on WAYS AND MEANS.","02/10/2021 - Hearing Scheduled 2/23 at 1:30 p.m.","03/11/2021 - From HOUSE Committee on WAYS AND MEANS:  Reported favorably.","03/12/2021 - Committee Report adopted on HOUSE floor.","03/12/2021 - Second reading passed. BILLSUMMARY: Requires a local board of elections to count an absentee ballot and reject a provisional ballot if the local board receives a legally sufficient absentee ballot and a provisional ballot from the same individual.

HISTORY: ["02/05/2021 - INTRODUCED.","02/05/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on WAYS AND MEANS.","02/10/2021 - Hearing Scheduled 2/23 at 1:30 p.m."]
BILLSUMMARY: Prohibits a person from willfully and knowingly taking certain actions to attempt to cause another person to commit a felony or a misdemeanor violation of election law, provides that a person who violates a certain provision of the Act is guilty of a felony and on conviction is subject to certain penalties, provides that a person who violates a certain provision of the Act is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject to certain penalties.

BILLSUMMARY: Requires the State Board of Elections to establish, by regulation, a process by which an individual may opt out of disclosure of personal information in the individual's voter registration record to any person other than an employee or a vendor of the State Board or a local board, prohibits personal information in an individual's voter registration record from being disclosed under certain provisions of law if the individual has opted out of disclosure.
