BILLSUMMARY: Requires, during a school redistricting process in which the redistricting plan proposed by the Howard County Board of Education differs from the redistricting plan proposed by the Howard County Superintendent of Schools, that the county board allow one or more members of a household whose school assignment is changed only in the county board's plan to provide public testimony before the final vote on either school redistricting plan.

HISTORY: ["02/08/2021 - INTRODUCED.","02/08/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on WAYS AND MEANS.","02/10/2021 - Hearing Scheduled 3/02 at 1:30 p.m.","03/11/2021 - From HOUSE Committee on WAYS AND MEANS:  Reported unfavorably."]
BILLSUMMARY: Requires that certain guidelines for absentee voting provide for the verification of signatures on absentee ballot envelopes, requires a voter to include certain documentation with an absentee ballot application, prohibits an absentee ballot from being removed from a certain envelope or counted except under certain circumstances, requires each local board of elections to verify the signature of a voter on an absentee ballot envelope in a certain manner.

BILLSUMMARY: Requires that certain guidelines for absentee voting provide for the verification of signatures on absentee ballot applications and absentee ballots, requires that certain absentee ballot applications and requests require a voter to indicate the voter's preferred method to receive communication, requires an election director to verify the signature on an absentee ballot application, a certain form, or a certain written request in a certain manner.

HISTORY: ["02/08/2021 - INTRODUCED.","02/08/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on WAYS AND MEANS.","02/10/2021 - Hearing Scheduled 3/09 at 1:30 p.m."]
BILLSUMMARY: Requires the State Board of Elections to submit a certain report to the General Assembly regarding the use of mail-in ballots in the 2020 presidential general election on or before July 4, 2021, requires the report to include certain information.

BILLSUMMARY: Prohibits a person from removing, defacing, damaging, destroying, or preventing the correct operation of a ballot drop box, prohibits a person from unlocking a ballot drop box except under certain circumstances.

HISTORY: ["02/08/2021 - INTRODUCED.","02/08/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on WAYS AND MEANS.","02/10/2021 - Hearing Scheduled 3/02 at 1:30 p.m."]
BILLSUMMARY: Requires each member of the State Board of Elections to have at least 5 years of experience in administering elections and have extensive knowledge of State election Laws, establishes the position of Racial Equity Coordinator within the State Board to ensure that all registered voters across the State receive the same treatment and access to resources, investigate racial disparities in ballot access and voter turnout, and make recommendations on ways to improve racial equity in the administration.

BILLSUMMARY: Requires an election judge to establish a voter's identity by requiring the voter to present certain proof of identity, requires the election judge to read the voter's name aloud, requires a voter to vote a provisional ballot if the voter is unable to provide certain proof of identity, prohibits a person from knowingly and willfully voting or attempting to vote under a false form of identification.

BILLSUMMARY: Extends the period of time after an offense was committed, from 3 to 4 years, during which a prosecution is required to be instituted for certain violations of State election law.

BILLSUMMARY: Requires photographic identification for the purpose of voting, requires the presentation of proof of identity in the form of a photograph identification document when voting in person, provides that acceptable photograph identification is a current and valid driver's license or nondriver identification card issued in this State, a United States passport, a military identification or a permit to carry a concealed handgun issued in this State if that permit includes a photograph.

BILLSUMMARY: Protects the privacy of absentee voters, requires an absentee ballot issued to a voter to be wrapped in a blank, opaque sleeve of paper or other material of sufficient thickness to prevent the writing on the ballot from being visible when placed in the ballot's return envelope.

BILLSUMMARY: Provides absentee ballot tracking for Maine voters, requires the Secretary of State to maintain the absentee ballot tracking service implemented by the Secretary of State that allows a voter who requests an absentee ballot to track the status of the voter's ballot from when the ballot was requested to when it is ultimately accepted or rejected by the municipal clerk.

BILLSUMMARY: Updates the voter registration process, provides for an online voter registration application, provides that registration applications submitted online must be received by the Secretary of State by midnight on the 21st day before election day and must be transmitted to the appropriate registrar's office daily, provides for what the application must include, provides one time funding for contracted programming costs to implement online voter registration.

BILLSUMMARY: Removes the prohibition against a municipal clerk's issuing an absentee ballot to any voter or immediate family member or 3rd person designated by the voter whose application or written request for an absentee ballot is received in the municipal office after the 3rd business day before election day, allows a municipality or jurisdiction that conducts its own elections to opt to process absentee ballots beginning on the 7th day immediately prior to election day.

BILLSUMMARY: Amends the voting laws in the following ways, prohibits incarcerated persons from voting, requires ballots to be in paper form, requires photo identification to vote, prohibits accepting ballots after the polls close, prohibits the buying of a vote by another person for money or any other thing of value, allows absentee voting only for a person who is unable to vote, the reason for which is certified by the person, and requires 2 other persons to collect and deliver the ballot.

BILLSUMMARY: Relates to elections determined by ranked choice voting, amends required number of signatures, changes dates related to presidential primary and eligible voters, provides that petitions must be delivered to the registrar for certification by a specified time and date, provides that petitions must be completed and filed with the Secretary of State no later than a specified date, provides for presidential primary elections and selection of delegates, relates to ranked choice voting and absentee ballots.

BILLSUMMARY: Provides that the county registrar or county election commission shall remove from the statewide elections management system those voters who fail, after having been mailed a confirmation notice, to either respond to the confirmation notice and vote at least once during a period of four consecutive years, which period shall include two general federal elections or update the voter's registration information and vote at least once during a period of four consecutive years.

BILLSUMMARY: Creates the State Voter Protection Act, creates bans on voter intimidation and voter suppression, creates a voter's bill of rights and require to be posted at every polling place, to be included with every distribution of official sample ballots and to be offered to voters at polling places, requires the secretary of state to create a manual of uniform polling place procedures and adopt the manual by regulation, for the purpose of possible amendment.

HISTORY: ["02/10/2022 - Amended on HOUSE floor.","02/10/2022 - Failed to pass HOUSE."]
BILLSUMMARY: Provides the fees to be charged for copies of statewide, district, county or municipal voter registration files when those files are requested by candidates for elective office, registered political parties and individuals requesting voter registration files other than their own, revises the monies that are deposited into the elections support fund, revises how the monies in the elections support fund are distributed and for what purposes they are spent.

HISTORY: ["01/18/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/18/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on CONSTITUTION.","01/18/2021 - Additionally referred to HOUSE Committee on JUDICIARY B.","02/02/2021 - Died in committee."]
BILLSUMMARY: Proposes an amendment to a section of Mississippi Constitution of 1890, to provide that a person who is otherwise a qualified elector and has been convicted of a felony shall have his or her right to vote suspended upon conviction and shall not have his or her right to vote restored until he or she has satisfied all of the sentencing requirements of the conviction, proposes the repeal of a section of Mississippi Constitution of 1890.

HISTORY: ["01/18/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/18/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on CONSTITUTION.","01/18/2021 - Additionally referred to HOUSE Committee on JUDICIARY B.","02/02/2021 - Died in committee."]
BILLSUMMARY: Proposes an amendment to a certain section of Mississippi Constitution of 1890, to provide that a person who is otherwise a qualified elector and has been convicted of voter fraud, bribery, theft, arson, obtaining money or goods under false pretense, perjury, forgery, embezzlement, bigamy or any crime interpreted as disenfranchising in later attorney general opinions except for murder and rape shall have his or her right to vote suspended upon conviction.

HISTORY: ["01/18/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/18/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on CONSTITUTION.","01/18/2021 - Additionally referred to HOUSE Committee on JUDICIARY B.","02/02/2021 - Died in committee."]
BILLSUMMARY: Proposes an amendment to a specified section of the Mississippi Constitution of 1890, provides for the automatic restoration of suffrage to any person disqualified by reason of a nonviolent crime, after a period of five years from the completion of any sentence, probation and/or payment of restitution.

HISTORY: "02/01/2022 - Died in committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Proposes an amendment to section 241, Mississippi Constitution of 1890, to provide that a person who is otherwise a qualified elector and has been convicted of voter fraud, bribery, theft, arson, obtaining money or goods under false pretense, perjury, forgery, embezzlement, bigamy or any crime interpreted as disenfranchising in later Attorney General opinions except for murder and rape shall have his or her right to vote suspended upon conviction and shall have his or her right to vote restored.

HISTORY: "02/01/2022 - Died in committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Proposes an amendment to the Mississippi Constitution of 1890 to provide that an early voting period shall be provided ten days before the date of each primary, general, runoff, special and municipal election for public office and continue until 5:00 p.m. on the Saturday preceding the election day.

HISTORY: "02/01/2022 - Died in committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Proposes an amendment to section 241, Mississippi Constitution of 1890, to provide that a person who is otherwise a qualified elector and has been convicted of a felony shall have his or her right to vote suspended upon conviction and shall not have his or her right to vote restored until he or she has satisfied all of the sentencing requirements of the conviction.

BILLSUMMARY: Reduces the length of time after the election within which a voter who is unable to present acceptable photographic identification must return to the circuit or municipal clerk's office to present photographic identification or execute a religious exemption affidavit, provides that such voters must return to the circuit or municipal clerk's office within three rather than five days to ensure that his or her ballot is counted.

HISTORY: ["01/05/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/05/2021 - To SENATE Committee on ELECTIONS.","01/05/2021 - Additionally referred to SENATE Committee on ACCOUNTABILITY, EFFICIENCY, TRANSPARENCY.","02/02/2021 - Died in committee."]

BILLSUMMARY: Codifies section 23 15 153.1, State code of 1972, to authorize and direct the Secretary of State to enter into a memorandum of understanding to compare the Statewide Elections Management System (SEMS) with public records to ensure non United States citizens are not registered to vote in this state, to provide that if evidence exists that a particular registered voter is not a citizen, the system shall notify the registrar who shall notify the registered voter to provide proof of citizenship.

BILLSUMMARY: Establishes the State Student Absentee Voter Act, provides that Mississippi citizens who reside outside the county or municipality of their residence because of their enrollment at an institution of higher learning may request and receive an absent elector's ballot, defines the term absent voter under the State Student Absentee Voter Act, authorizes the secretary of state to promulgate rules and regulations as may be necessary.

BILLSUMMARY: Requires that elections in local governments with one or more offices up for election in 2021 where the candidate for that office is elected by district shall be delayed until 2022, requires local governments with delayed 2021 elections to review and revise those electoral districts following the release of the 2020 U.S. census data, provides that regular municipal elections in the city of Raleigh shall be held in even numbered years.

HISTORY: ["01/04/2021 - PREFILED.","01/04/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on ELECTION LAW.","01/05/2021 - Filed as LSR 231.","01/06/2021 - Introduced","01/06/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on ELECTION LAW.","01/20/2021 - Public Hearing: 01/29/2021.","02/10/2021 - Executive Session: 02/17/2021.","02/18/2021 - From HOUSE Committee on ELECTION LAW:  Ought to pass.","04/08/2021 - Passed HOUSE.  *****To SENATE.","04/13/2021 - To SENATE Committee on ELECTION LAW AND MUNICIPAL AFFAIRS.","04/14/2021 - Remote Hearing 04/19/2021.","05/11/2021 - From SENATE Committee on ELECTION LAW AND MUNICIPAL AFFAIRS: Ought to pass with amendment.","05/20/2021 - Committee amendment adopted on SENATE floor.","05/20/2021 - Passed SENATE.  *****To HOUSE for concurrence.","06/10/2021 - HOUSE concurred in SENATE amendments.","07/12/2021 - Ordered Enrolled.","07/23/2021 - Signed by GOVERNOR.","07/23/2021 - Chapter No. 132"]

BILLSUMMARY: Relates to elections, requires the Secretary of State to allow an elector with a disability to register to vote and a registered voter with a disability to request and cast an absent ballot using the system of approved electronic transmission established for certain uniformed military and overseas voters, sets forth certain requirements for such an elector or registered voter to use the system of approved electronic transmission, eliminates the requirement to cancel a persons voter registration.

BILLSUMMARY: Relates to elections, revises provisions relating to voting by absent ballots or mailing ballots, revises provisions relating to the verification of absent ballots and mailing ballots, revises the procedures for counting absent ballots and mailing ballots, revises provisions relating to assisting a voter complete an absent ballot or mailing ballot, prohibits certain persons from returning an absent ballot or mailing ballot on behalf of a registered voter, repeals provisions related to voting by mail.

BILLSUMMARY: Relates to elections, requires, with certain exceptions, proof of identity for voting in person, requires the Department of Motor Vehicles, under certain circumstances, to issue voter identification cards at no cost, provides other matters properly relating thereto.

BILLSUMMARY: Relates to elections, requires the Secretary of State to create a centralized database that collects and stores voter preregistration and registration information from all of the counties, requires each county clerk to use the database created by the Secretary of State to collect and store preregistration and registration information, makes various other changes related to the creation and use of the database created by the Secretary of State, revises provisions governing risk limiting audits of elections.

HISTORY: ["03/26/2021 - INTRODUCED.","03/26/2021 - Filed as Bill Draft Request No. 1039.","03/26/2021 - To ASSEMBLY Committee on LEGISLATIVE OPERATIONS AND ELECTIONS.","04/09/2021 - Waiver granted.","05/26/2021 - From ASSEMBLY Committee on LEGISLATIVE OPERATIONS AND ELECTIONS:  Do pass with amendment.","05/26/2021 - Declared an Emergency Measure under the Constitution.","05/26/2021 - Committee amendment adopted on ASSEMBLY floor.","05/26/2021 - Rereferred to ASSEMBLY Committee on WAYS AND MEANS.","05/26/2021 - From ASSEMBLY Committee on WAYS AND MEANS:  Do pass with amendment.","05/26/2021 - Ordered Engrossed.","05/28/2021 - From ASSEMBLY Committee on WAYS AND MEANS:  Do pass with amendment.","05/28/2021 - Committee amendment adopted on ASSEMBLY floor.","05/28/2021 - Passed ASSEMBLY.  *****To SENATE.","05/28/2021 - Ordered Engrossed. Second Reprint.","05/29/2021 - To SENATE Committee on FINANCE.","05/30/2021 - From SENATE Committee on FINANCE:  Do pass.","05/31/2021 - Passed SENATE.","05/31/2021 - To enrollment.","06/03/2021 - *****To GOVERNOR.","06/11/2021 - Signed by GOVERNOR.","06/11/2021 - Chaptered.  Chapter No. 555"]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to elections, provides that certain agencies of the Executive Department of the State Government are automatic voter registration agencies, authorizes the Governor to designate additional state agencies and certain tribal agencies as automatic voter registration agencies, sets forth the requirements for an automatic voter registration agency to transmit certain voter registration information to the Secretary of State and county clerks, makes changes to existing automatic voter registration process.

HISTORY: ["03/19/2021 - INTRODUCED.","03/19/2021 - Filed as Bill Draft Request No. 652.","03/19/2021 - To ASSEMBLY Committee on LEGISLATIVE OPERATIONS AND ELECTIONS.","04/10/2021 - Pursuant to Joint Standing Rule No. 14.3.1, no further action allowed."]
BILLSUMMARY: Proposes to amend the Nevada Constitution to require the Legislature to canvass the vote for certain elections and certify results of such elections.

AUTHORNAME: Senate Select Committee on Redistricting and Elections
HISTORY: ["11/12/2021 - INTRODUCED.","11/12/2021 - Filed as Bill Draft Request No. 9.","11/12/2021 - To SENATE Committee on REDISTRICTING AND ELECTIONS.","11/13/2021 - From SENATE Committee on REDISTRICTING AND ELECTIONS: Do Pass.","11/14/2021 - Passed SENATE.  *****To ASSEMBLY.","11/14/2021 - To ASSEMBLY Select Committee on REDISTRICTING AND ELECTIONS","11/15/2021 - From ASSEMBLY Committee on REDISTRICTING AND ELECTIONS:  Do pass with amendment.","11/15/2021 - Committee amendment adopted on ASSEMBLY floor.","11/16/2021 - Ordered Engrossed.","11/16/2021 - Passed ASSEMBLY.  *****To SENATE for concurrence.","11/16/2021 - SENATE concurred in ASSEMBLY amendments.","11/16/2021 - Eligible for GOVERNOR'S desk.","11/16/2021 - To enrollment.","11/16/2021 - *****To GOVERNOR.","11/16/2021 - Signed by GOVERNOR.","11/16/2021 - Chaptered.  Chapter No. 1"]
BILLSUMMARY: Revises the election districts for members of the Legislature, members of the State Board of Education and Representatives in Congress and the petition districts for certain statewide initiatives or referendums.

HISTORY: ["01/28/2021 - PREFILED.","01/28/2021 - To SENATE Committee on LEGISLATIVE OPERATIONS AND ELECTIONS.","02/01/2021 - INTRODUCED.","02/01/2021 - To SENATE Committee on LEGISLATIVE OPERATIONS AND ELECTIONS.","02/01/2021 - Filed as Bill Draft Request No. 532.","04/12/2021 - From SENATE Committee on LEGISLATIVE OPERATIONS AND ELECTIONS:  Do pass.","04/13/2021 - Passed SENATE.  *****To ASSEMBLY.","04/14/2021 - To ASSEMBLY Committee on LEGISLATIVE OPERATIONS AND ELECTIONS.","05/17/2021 - From ASSEMBLY Committee on LEGISLATIVE OPERATIONS AND ELECTIONS:  Do pass.","05/21/2021 - Passed ASSEMBLY.","05/24/2021 - To enrollment.","05/25/2021 - *****To GOVERNOR.","05/27/2021 - Signed by GOVERNOR.","05/27/2021 - Chaptered.  Chapter No. 159"]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to election precincts, changes the maximum number of active registered voters that may be included within an election precinct, provides other matters properly relating thereto.

HISTORY: ["02/04/2021 - INTRODUCED.","02/04/2021 - Filed as Bill Draft Request No. 599.","02/04/2021 - To SENATE Committee on LEGISLATIVE OPERATIONS AND ELECTIONS.","04/10/2021 - Pursuant to Joint Standing Rule No. 14.3.1, no further action allowed."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to elections, authorizes a registered voter to notify the county clerk that the registered voter wants to be required to present photo identification to vote in person at a polling place, requires, with certain exceptions, such a registered voter to present photo identification in order to vote in person at a polling place, provides other matters properly relating thereto.

HISTORY: ["03/11/2021 - INTRODUCED.","03/11/2021 - Filed as Bill Draft Request No. 550.","03/11/2021 - To SENATE Committee on LEGISLATIVE OPERATIONS AND ELECTIONS.","04/10/2021 - Pursuant to Joint Standing Rule No. 14.3.1, no further action allowed."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to elections, requires the Secretary of State to adopt regulations setting forth the forms of proof of identity required to vote in person, requiring, under certain circumstances, a comprehensive audit of an election, requires the Secretary of State to assign a unique ballot identification number to each absent and mailing ballot, requires proof of identity for voting in person, revises the deadline for requesting an absent ballot.

HISTORY: ["03/16/2021 - INTRODUCED.","03/16/2021 - Filed as Bill Draft Request No. 896.","03/16/2021 - To SENATE Committee on LEGISLATIVE OPERATIONS AND ELECTIONS.","04/19/2021 - From SENATE Committee on LEGISLATIVE OPERATIONS AND ELECTIONS:  Do pass with amendment.","04/19/2021 - Committee amendment adopted on SENATE floor.","04/19/2021 - Ordered Engrossed.","04/20/2021 - Passed SENATE.  *****To ASSEMBLY.","04/22/2021 - To ASSEMBLY Committee on LEGISLATIVE OPERATIONS AND ELECTIONS.","05/15/2021 - Pursuant to Joint Standing Rule No. 14.3.3, no further action allowed."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to elections, eliminates the requirement to cancel a person's voter registration if a person changes his or her party affiliation, revises the deadlines by which military and overseas voters may submit certain applications to register to vote and cast a ballot, provides other matters properly relating thereto.

HISTORY: ["03/22/2021 - INTRODUCED.","03/22/2021 - Filed as Bill Draft Request No. 898.","03/22/2021 - To SENATE Committee on LEGISLATIVE OPERATIONS AND ELECTIONS.","04/10/2021 - Pursuant to Joint Standing Rule No. 14.3.1, no further action allowed."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to elections, establishes procedures for the use of mail ballots in every election, revises the deadline for counting mail ballots, requires the Secretary of State to establish a uniform set of procedures that must be used by election officials to verify the signature of a registered voter, makes the registrar of voters an elected office, repeals provisions relating to absent ballots, mailing ballots and elections affected by certain emergencies or disasters, makes an appropriation.

HISTORY: ["05/29/2021 - INTRODUCED.","05/29/2021 - Filed as Bill Draft Request No. 1180.","05/29/2021 - To SENATE Committee on LEGISLATIVE OPERATIONS AND ELECTIONS.","06/01/2021 - No further action taken."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to legislative affairs, creates the Reapportionment and Redistricting Advisory Commission, prescribes the membership of the Commission, sets forth the duties of the Commission, provides other matters properly relating thereto.

HISTORY: ["05/21/2021 - INTRODUCED.","05/21/2021 - Filed as Bill Draft Request No. 1166.","05/21/2021 - To SENATE Committee on LEGISLATIVE OPERATIONS AND ELECTIONS.","05/26/2021 - From SENATE Committee on LEGISLATIVE OPERATIONS AND ELECTIONS:  Do pass.","05/26/2021 - Passed SENATE."]
BILLSUMMARY: Creates an interim committee to conduct an investigation into matters relating to reapportionment and redistricting in the State of Nevada.

HISTORY: ["03/17/2021 - INTRODUCED.","03/17/2021 - Filed as Bill Draft Request No. 160.","03/17/2021 - To SENATE Committee on LEGISLATIVE OPERATIONS AND ELECTIONS.","04/10/2021 - Pursuant to Joint Standing Rule No. 14.3.1, no further action allowed."]
BILLSUMMARY: Proposes to amend the Nevada Constitution to remove the constitutional provisions governing the Legislature's authority to apportion Senators and members of the Assembly among counties or legislative districts of the State and create an Independent Redistricting Commission vested with the power to apportion Senators and members of the Assembly in the Legislature and members of the United States House of Representatives among districts established by the Commission.

HISTORY: "01/05/2022 - To ASSEMBLY Committee on ELECTION LAW."
BILLSUMMARY: Establishes an electronic military ballot application and military ballot transmittal system through which applicants may apply for a military ballot and return a marked military ballot, online.

BILLSUMMARY: Requires the board of elections to provide the public with free and timely access to updated absentee ballot data.

BILLSUMMARY: Authorizes the county seat in Washington County to have at least one polling place designated for early voting.

BILLSUMMARY: Permits voter registration within 10 days of a primary, general, or special election.

BILLSUMMARY: Relates to validating absentee ballots, relates to when absentee ballot envelopes and absentee ballots are examined to determine the validity of such absentee ballots, allows for the surrender of absentee ballots in certain situations, authorizes poll watchers to be present at meetings related to examining absentee ballot envelopes.

HISTORY: "01/05/2022 - To ASSEMBLY Committee on ELECTION LAW."
BILLSUMMARY: Allows for a voter to apply for an absentee ballot for any reason.

HISTORY: "01/05/2022 - To ASSEMBLY Committee on ELECTION LAW."
BILLSUMMARY: Authorizes the Westchester County board of elections to merge any election district with 50 or fewer registered voters into an existing election district.

HISTORY: ["01/20/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/20/2021 - To SENATE Committee on RULES AND EXECUTIVE NOMINATIONS."]
BILLSUMMARY: Declares, in response to significant activities contravening the Pennsylvania Election Code, that the Pennsylvania General Election to appoint electors of President and Vice President is unlawful, void ab initio and invalid, and that the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania has failed to appoint electors of President and Vice President on the day prescribed by law, exercises the plenary power of the General Assembly, under the Constitution of the United States, to appoint electors of President.

HISTORY: ["01/20/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/20/2021 - To SENATE Committee on RULES AND EXECUTIVE NOMINATIONS."]
BILLSUMMARY: (Concurrent Resolution) Declares, in response to significant activities contravening the Pennsylvania Election Code, that the Pennsylvania General Election to appoint electors of President and Vice President was unlawful, void ab initio and invalid, and that the Commonwealth has failed to appoint electors of President and Vice President on the day prescribed by law and exercising the plenary power of the General Assembly, under the Constitution of the United States, to appoint electors.

HISTORY: "03/01/2021 - In HOUSE Committee on STATE GOVERNMENT AND ELECTIONS: Committee recommends measure to be held for further study."
BILLSUMMARY: Requires that the state use the actual residences of persons in government custody for census and redistricting purposes, provides that such information would be determined by the department of corrections and the secretary of state, and forwarded to the United States census bureau.

HISTORY: "07/01/2021 - Passed HOUSE.  *****To SENATE."
BILLSUMMARY: Changes the time in which the state registrar of vital records would be required to provide the secretary of state with the list of reported deaths from monthly to bi monthly, changes the time in which the Secretary of State would be required to provide each local board of canvassers with the list of deceased persons to be removed from the voter registration list.

HISTORY: ["06/03/2021 - Passed HOUSE.  *****To SENATE.","06/04/2021 - To SENATE Committee on JUDICIARY."]
BILLSUMMARY: Includes the general assembly elections within the category of elections subject to the risk-limiting audits within the jurisdiction of the board of elections.

HISTORY: "03/15/2021 - In HOUSE Committee on STATE GOVERNMENT AND ELECTIONS: Committee recommends measure to be held for further study."
BILLSUMMARY: Allows individuals, who have not reached the age of 18 years, to vote in a primary election, as long as the voter will be 18 as of the date of the general or special election.

HISTORY: "03/15/2021 - In HOUSE Committee on STATE GOVERNMENT AND ELECTIONS: Committee recommends measure to be held for further study."
BILLSUMMARY: NA

HISTORY: "03/24/2021 - In HOUSE Committee on STATE GOVERNMENT AND ELECTIONS: Committee recommends measure to be held for further study."
BILLSUMMARY: Increases the role of the division of motor vehicles in the voter registration and address verification process, by establishing very specific obligations.

HISTORY: "03/15/2021 - In HOUSE Committee on STATE GOVERNMENT AND ELECTIONS: Committee recommends measure to be held for further study."
BILLSUMMARY: NA

HISTORY: ["02/24/2021 - INTRODUCED.","02/24/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on JUDICIARY.","03/26/2021 - Transferred to HOUSE Committee on STATE GOVERNMENT AND ELECTIONS.","04/08/2021 - Scheduled for hearing and/or consideration 04/12/2021.","04/12/2021 - In HOUSE Committee on STATE GOVERNMENT AND ELECTIONS: Committee recommends measure to be held for further study."]
BILLSUMMARY: Creates a special commission on reapportionment to redistrict the districts of the general assembly and the state's congressional districts based on the data collected by the federal Census.

HISTORY: "05/14/2021 - To SENATE Committee on JUDICIARY."
BILLSUMMARY: Allows the board of elections to begin the certification of mail ballots prior to election day and requires notice of such certification sessions.

HISTORY: "03/24/2021 - In HOUSE Committee on STATE GOVERNMENT AND ELECTIONS: Committee recommends measure to be held for further study."
BILLSUMMARY: Requires the secretary of state to promulgate regulations which identify and cancel the voter registration, of any registrant that changes their residence to outside their city or town, without notifying the proper authorities.

HISTORY: "05/07/2021 - To SENATE Committee on JUDICIARY."
BILLSUMMARY: Repeals a mail ballot section entitled Mail applicant not permitted to vote at polls, follows the federal Help America Vote Act (HAVA) and to account for permitting voters to cast provisional ballots at the polling place.

HISTORY: "03/15/2021 - In HOUSE Committee on STATE GOVERNMENT AND ELECTIONS: Committee recommends measure to be held for further study."
BILLSUMMARY: Proposes an amendment to the state constitution eliminating the residency and registration requirement before voting in an election.

HISTORY: "03/15/2021 - In HOUSE Committee on STATE GOVERNMENT AND ELECTIONS: Committee recommends measure to be held for further study."
BILLSUMMARY: Amends various sections of law governing mail ballots including changes to the witness and notary public requirements by removing the witness and notary requirement for mail ballot applications and mail ballot certificate envelope, deletes the requirement that person may vote by mail, only if they are unable to vote in person.

HISTORY: "03/24/2021 - In HOUSE Committee on STATE GOVERNMENT AND ELECTIONS: Committee recommends measure to be held for further study."
BILLSUMMARY: NA

HISTORY: "06/17/2021 - To SENATE Committee on JUDICIARY."
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to elections, relates to mail ballots, entitles disabled and military voters to utilize electronically transmitted ballots.

HISTORY: "03/24/2021 - In HOUSE Committee on STATE GOVERNMENT AND ELECTIONS: Committee recommends measure to be held for further study."
BILLSUMMARY: Prohibits the secretary of state from mass mailing mail ballot applications and would require that the elector request a mail ballot.

HISTORY: "04/12/2021 - In HOUSE Committee on STATE GOVERNMENT AND ELECTIONS: Committee recommends measure to be held for further study."
BILLSUMMARY: Creates a redistricting commission to adopt a redistricting plan for all general assembly and congressional districts, provides for a possible right of appeal of the plan, to the state supreme court.

HISTORY: "04/12/2021 - In HOUSE Committee on STATE GOVERNMENT AND ELECTIONS: Committee recommends measure to be held for further study."
BILLSUMMARY: NA

HISTORY: "04/12/2021 - In HOUSE Committee on STATE GOVERNMENT AND ELECTIONS: Committee recommends measure to be held for further study."
BILLSUMMARY: Requires for adoption of redistricting legislation an affirmative vote of a majority of representatives and senators voting by each of the chambers and by a majority of representatives and senators in the largest two member-represented political parties.

BILLSUMMARY: Addresses voter signature verification, voter accessibility, and related issues, provides guidance for determining when a signature submitted with a ballot corresponds to a signature in a voter registration record, establishes requirements for contacting a voter when the voters ballot is rejected, establishes record keeping and reporting requirements in relation to rejected ballots, requires an election officer to provide an accessible voting option for a voter with a disability.

BILLSUMMARY: Repeals current Utah State Board of Education district boundaries and establishes new Utah State Board of Education district boundaries, establishes election dates for Utah State Board of Education districts to ensure that Utah State Board of Education terms are staggered, establishes the block equivalency file as the legal boundaries of Utah State Board of Education districts, makes technical and conforming changes.

HISTORY: ["11/09/2021 - INTRODUCED.","11/09/2021 - To SENATE Committee on RULES.","11/09/2021 - From SENATE Committee on RULES.","11/09/2021 - Placed on 2nd Reading calendar.","11/10/2021 - Substituted on SENATE floor.","11/10/2021 - Passed 2nd Reading.","11/10/2021 - Passed SENATE.  *****To HOUSE.","11/10/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on RULES.","11/10/2021 - From HOUSE Committee on RULES.","11/10/2021 - Placed on 3rd Reading calendar.","11/10/2021 - Placed on 3rd Reading.","11/10/2021 - Passed HOUSE.","11/15/2021 - Enrolled.","11/16/2021 - *****To GOVERNOR.","11/16/2021 - Signed by GOVERNOR.","11/30/2021 - Chaptered. BILLSUMMARY: Repeals current State Senate boundaries, establishes new State Senate boundaries, designates the election year for each Utah State Senate district, establishes the block equivalency file that is part of this bill in electronic form as the legal boundaries of the Utah State Senate districts, provides a hash code to verify the authenticity of the block equivalency file, makes technical and conforming changes.

HISTORY: "02/15/2022 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Left in committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to voter identification, relates to identification containing a photograph required, requires presentation of a form of identification containing a photograph in order to vote, repeals the provisions of law permitting a voter who does not have one of the required forms of identification to vote after signing a statement, subject to felony penalties for false statements, that he is the named registered voter he claims to be.

HISTORY: ["11/19/2019 - PREFILED.","01/08/2020 - INTRODUCED.","01/08/2020 - To HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","01/31/2020 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Continued to 2021."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to voter registration, relates to close of registration records, reduces the period of time that registration records must be closed before a general or primary election from 21 days to 13 days, adjusts other deadlines to reflect this change, provides that the period of time that the registration records must be closed before a special election remains the same.

HISTORY: "02/22/2022 - In SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Passed by indefinitely."
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to absentee voting, relates to return of absentee ballots, relates to drop-off locations, repeals the provisions of law providing for the establishment of drop-off locations for the return of absentee ballots.

HISTORY: "02/15/2022 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Left in committee."
BILLSUMMARY: NA

HISTORY: "02/15/2022 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Left in committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to absentee voting, relates to permanent absentee voter list repealed, repeals the provisions of law by which any registered voter may apply to receive absentee ballots for all elections in which he is eligible to vote and remains on the list until the voter requests in writing to be removed from the list, the voter's registration is canceled or placed on inactive status pursuant to law, or the voter moves to a different address not in the same county or city of his registration.

HISTORY: "02/22/2022 - In SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Passed by indefinitely."
BILLSUMMARY: NA

BILLSUMMARY: Relates to elections, relates to voter identification containing a photograph required, relates to permanent absentee voter list repealed, requires presentation of a form of identification containing a photograph in order to vote, repeals the provisions of law permitting a voter who does not have one of the required forms of identification to vote after signing a statement, subject to felony penalties for false statements, that he is the named registered voter he claims to be.

HISTORY: "02/15/2022 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Left in committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to elections, relates to absentee voting, relates to ballots to be sorted and results to be reported by precinct, provides that absentee ballots processed at a central absentee precinct must be sorted by the precinct to which the voter who cast the absentee ballot is assigned and that the resulting vote totals from such ballots must be reported separately for each voter precinct.

BILLSUMMARY: NA

HISTORY: "03/12/2022 - In SENATE Committee on FINANCE AND APPROPRIATIONS:  Left in committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to voter registration, relates to presumption of domicile, relates to members of a uniformed service and others, provides that a member of a uniformed service who is on active duty with permanent orders stationing him in the Commonwealth shall be presumed to have established domicile for purposes of satisfying the residency requirements for voter registration, if he has also established physical presence and a place of abode in the Commonwealth, unless he expressly States otherwise.

HISTORY: "02/15/2022 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Left in committee."
BILLSUMMARY: NA

HISTORY: "02/15/2022 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Left in committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Proposes a constitutional amendment, relates to qualifications of voters and the right to vote, relates to persons not entitled to vote, provides for a referendum at a specified date, general election to approve or reject an amendment that would provide for the fundamental right to vote in the Commonwealth, revise the qualifications of voters so that a person convicted of a felony is not entitled to vote during his period of incarceration.

HISTORY: "02/15/2022 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Left in committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to absentee ballots, relates to witness requirement, relates to printed name and residence address, requires that a witness to a voter's absentee ballot provide, in addition to his signature, his printed name, his date of birth, the last four digits of his social security number, and his residence address.

HISTORY: "03/01/2022 - In SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Passed by indefinitely."
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to absentee voting, relates to annual absentee voter list, relates to applications for ballots, removes the permanent absentee voter list and provides for an annual absentee voter list by which any eligible voter who annually files an application and is enrolled on the list receives an absentee ballot for any election in which he is eligible to vote in the ensuing calendar year, requires the voter's printed name, birth date, and the last four digits of his social security number.

HISTORY: "03/12/2022 - In HOUSE: Continued to a 2022 Special Session."
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to elections, relates to absentee voting, relates to witness requirement, relates to printed name and residence address, removes the witness requirement for absentee ballots and replaces it with the requirement that the voter provide the last four number of his social security number and his date of birth.

HISTORY: "02/15/2022 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Left in committee."
BILLSUMMARY: NA

HISTORY: "02/22/2022 - In SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Passed by indefinitely."
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to voter registration, relates to registration permitted up to and including the day of the election, repeals a provision that would permit any person who is qualified to register to vote to register to vote in person up to and including the day of the election, notwithstanding any deadline for the close of registration records, provides that the repeal will limit the persons who are entitled to register to vote after the close of registration records to any member of a uniformed service.

HISTORY: "02/15/2022 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Left in committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to voter registration, relates to registration permitted up to and including the day of the election, repeals a provision that would permit any person who is qualified to register to vote to register to vote in person up to and including the day of the election, notwithstanding any deadline for the close of registration records, provides that the repeal will limit the persons who are entitled to register to vote after the close of registration records to any member of a uniformed service.

BILLSUMMARY: NA

HISTORY: "02/22/2022 - In SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Passed by indefinitely."
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to absentee voting, relates to permanent absentee voter list repealed, repeals the provisions of law by which any registered voter may apply to receive absentee ballots for all elections in which he is eligible to vote and remains on the list until the voter requests in writing to be removed from the list, the voter's registration is canceled or placed on inactive status pursuant to law, or the voter moves to a different address not in the same county or city of his registration.

HISTORY: "02/15/2022 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Left in committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to absentee voting, relates to permanent absentee voter list, relates to annual notice required, relates to reasons for removal, requires general registrars to send, by December 15 of each year, notice to each voter enrolled on the permanent absentee voter list that the voter is currently enrolled on the permanent absentee voter list and will remain enrolled on such list unless the voter requests to be removed, provides that the notice shall include a return card.

HISTORY: ["12/27/2019 - PREFILED.","01/08/2020 - INTRODUCED.","01/08/2020 - To HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","01/31/2020 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Continued to 2021."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to absentee voting, relates to counting military and overseas absentee ballots received after close of polls on election day, provides that absentee ballots cast by military and overseas absentee voters that are received after the close of the polls on any election day but before a specified time on the second business day before the State Board of Elections meets to ascertain the results of the election and postmarked on or before the date of such election are to be counted if the voter is found.

HISTORY: ["12/27/2019 - PREFILED.","01/08/2020 - INTRODUCED.","01/08/2020 - To HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","01/31/2020 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Continued to 2021."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to voter registration, relates to preregistration for persons age 16 or older, permits a person who is otherwise qualified to register to vote and is 16 years of age or older, but who will not be 18 years of age on or before the day of the next general election, to preregister to vote, provides that the preregistration does not entitle such a person to vote in any election except as already permitted by law, the bill requires the Department of Elections to maintain a record of all preregistered.

HISTORY: ["12/27/2019 - PREFILED.","01/08/2020 - INTRODUCED.","01/08/2020 - To HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","01/31/2020 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Continued to 2021."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to voter registration, relates to automatic voter registration, provides for the automatic electronic transmission by the Department of Motor Vehicles to the Department of Elections of certain information for any individual who is not registered to vote, is of sufficient age to register to vote, conducts a transaction with the Department of Motor Vehicles to apply for a new driver's license or special identification card or replace, renew, or update an existing driver's license.

HISTORY: "03/12/2022 - In HOUSE: Continued to a 2022 Special Session."
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to elections, applies the provisions of the Virginia Personnel Act to the chief deputy and confidential assistant for policy or administration for the Department of Elections, provides that also expands the membership of the State Board of Elections from five members to six members with equal representation given to both parties, gives the State Board of Elections the authority and duty to appoint the Commissioner of Elections of the Department of Elections by a supermajority vote.

HISTORY: "02/15/2022 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Left in committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to absentee voting, relates to application requirements, relates to absentee ballot requirements, requires an applicant for an absentee ballot to provide the last four digits of his social security number on the application regardless of whether he is completing the application in person and makes the failure of the absentee voter to have a witness sign his absentee ballot envelope a material omission that renders the ballot void, removes the permanent absentee voter list.

HISTORY: "02/15/2022 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Left in committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to elections, relates to absentee voting, relates to ballots to be sorted and results to be reported by precinct, provides that absentee ballots processed at a central absentee precinct must be sorted by the precinct to which the voter who cast the absentee ballot is assigned and that the resulting vote totals from such ballots must be reported separately for each voter precinct.

BILLSUMMARY: Relates to absentee voting, relates to unsolicited absentee ballot applications, relates to required information, requires any individual or organization sending an application for an absentee ballot to a registered voter that was not solicited or requested by the registered voter to include with the application instructions on completing the application and submitting it to the appropriate general registrar.

HISTORY: "02/22/2022 - In SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Passed by indefinitely."
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to voter identification, relates to optional restrictive identification requirement, allows a voter to opt into being required to show a valid photo identification issued by the Commonwealth, one of its political subdivisions, or the United States when voting in person, provides that when a voter offers to vote and the pollbook indicates he has opted into such requirement, he shall be required to show a valid photo identification issued by the Commonwealth.

HISTORY: "02/15/2022 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Left in committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to elections, relates to photo identification required, relates to time for in-person absentee, relates to absentee ballots not accepted after election day, relates to repeal of permanent absentee voter list, requires presentation of a form of identification containing a photograph in order to vote, repeals the provisions of law permitting a voter who does not have one of the required forms of identification to vote after signing a statement, subject to specified penalties.

HISTORY: "02/15/2022 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Left in committee."

BILLSUMMARY: Relates to voter registration, relates to restoration of political rights upon release from incarceration, relates to certain adjudications, provides that any person who loses his political rights as a result of a felony conviction shall be invested with those rights upon his release from incarceration and shall be entitled to register to vote, directs the Department of Corrections and the State Board of Local and Regional Jails to transmit to the Department of Elections certain information.

BILLSUMMARY: Relates to absentee voting in person, relates to available beginning on the tenth day prior to election, limits absentee voting in person to the ten days immediately preceding an election.

HISTORY: "02/22/2022 - In SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Passed by indefinitely."
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to absentee voting, relates to deadline for returning absentee ballot, requires that an absentee ballot be received before the closing of the polls on election day in order to be counted, provides that currently, an absentee ballot that is received after the closing of the polls but before noon on the third day after the election is counted if it is postmarked on or before the date of the election.

HISTORY: "01/21/2022 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Tabled."
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to assistance for certain voters outside of the polling place, relates to definition of disability, expands the definition of disability for purposes of providing assistance outside of a polling place to voters with disabilities to include any permanent or temporary disability, under current law, the disability is limited to a permanent or temporary physical disability.

BILLSUMMARY: Relates to voter identification, relates to identification containing a photograph required, requires presentation of a form of identification containing a photograph in order to vote, repeals the provisions of law permitting a voter who does not have one of the required forms of identification to vote after signing a statement, subject to felony penalties for false statements, that he is the named registered voter he claims to be.

BILLSUMMARY: NA

BILLSUMMARY: NA

HISTORY: "02/15/2022 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Left in committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to absentee voting, relates to return of absentee ballots, relates to drop off locations, repeals the provisions of law providing for the establishment of drop off locations for the return of absentee ballots.

HISTORY: ["12/03/2020 - PREFILED.","01/13/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/13/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","02/05/2021 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Left in committee."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to conduct of elections, relates to vote counting, relates to required live video recording, requires the general registrar of each county and city to provide for a live video recording of each polling place while absentee ballots are cast, votes are counted, and returns are completed, and of each central absentee precinct while ballots are handled and returns are completed, provides that the general registrars are required to ensure the video coverage is recorded and retained until the deadline.

HISTORY: ["12/17/2020 - PREFILED.","01/13/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/13/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","02/05/2021 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Left in committee."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to voter registration, relates to list maintenance, relates to lists of decedents transmitted by State Registrar of Vital Records, requires the State Registrar of Vital Records to transmit to the Department of Elections a weekly list of decedents from the previous week, currently, this list is transmitted monthly, requires the general registrars to use this information to conduct list maintenance and to promptly cancel the registration of a person on the list.

HISTORY: ["01/05/2021 - PREFILED.","01/05/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","01/13/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/13/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","01/13/2021 - From HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Reported with amendment.","01/18/2021 - Committee amendment adopted on HOUSE floor.","01/18/2021 - Engrossed by HOUSE as amended.","01/18/2021 - Engrossment reconsidered.","01/18/2021 - Engrossed by HOUSE as amended.","01/19/2021 - Passed HOUSE.  *****To SENATE.","01/20/2021 - To SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","02/05/2021 - In SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Continued to 2021 Special Session I.","02/16/2021 - From SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Reported favorably.","02/19/2021 - Passed SENATE.","02/24/2021 - Eligible for GOVERNOR'S desk.","03/18/2021 - Signed by GOVERNOR.","03/18/2021 - Acts of Assembly.  Chapter No. 159"]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to voter registration, relates to failure of online voter registration system, relates to deadline extension, provides that in the event that a failure of the Virginia online voter registration system occurs prior to the close of registration records, the Governor has the authority to order the online voter registration system to be available for registration activities after the date for closing the registration records for a specified period of time.

HISTORY: ["01/08/2021 - PREFILED.","01/08/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","01/13/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/13/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","01/13/2021 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Passed by indefinitely."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to absentee voting, relates to unsolicited absentee ballot applications, relates to required information, requires any individual or organization sending an application for an absentee ballot to a registered voter that was not solicited or requested by the registered voter to include with the application instructions on completing the application and submitting it to the appropriate general registrar.

HISTORY: ["01/08/2021 - PREFILED.","01/08/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","01/13/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/13/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","02/05/2021 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Left in committee."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to elections, relates to preclearance of certain covered practices required, requires the governing body of a covered jurisdiction, prior to enacting or seeking to administer any voting qualification or prerequisite to voting, or any standard, practice, or procedure with respect to voting, to either institute an action in the Circuit Court of the City of Richmond for a declaratory judgment that the covered practice neither has the purpose or effect of denying or abridging the right to vote.

BILLSUMMARY: Relates to absentee voting, relates to procedural and process reforms, relates to availability and accessibility reforms, relates to penalty, makes various reforms to absentee voting processes and procedures, including those related to availability and accessibility.

HISTORY: ["01/08/2021 - PREFILED.","01/08/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","01/13/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/13/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","01/27/2021 - From HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Reported with substitute.","01/27/2021 - Committee substitute printed.","01/27/2021 - Substitute reprinted.","01/29/2021 - Committee substitute adopted on HOUSE floor.","01/29/2021 - Engrossed by HOUSE as substituted.","02/01/2021 - Passed HOUSE.  *****To SENATE.","02/02/2021 - To SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","02/05/2021 - In SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Continued to 2021 Special Session I.","02/16/2021 - From SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Reported favorably.","02/16/2021 - Re-referred to SENATE Committee on FINANCE AND APPROPRIATIONS.","02/22/2021 - From SENATE Committee on FINANCE AND APPROPRIATIONS:  Reported favorably.","02/25/2021 - Passed SENATE.","03/09/2021 - Eligible for GOVERNOR'S desk.","03/31/2021 - *****Returned to HOUSE with GOVERNOR'S recommendations.","04/07/2021 - HOUSE accepts GOVERNOR'S recommended amendments.","04/07/2021 - SENATE accepts GOVERNOR'S recommended amendments.","04/07/2021 - Reenrolled.","04/07/2021 - Acts of Assembly. BILLSUMMARY: Relates to elections, relates to prohibited discrimination in voting and elections administration, relates to required process for enacting certain covered practices, relates to civil causes of action, prohibits any voting qualification or any standard, practice, or procedure related to voting from being imposed or applied in a manner that results in the denial or abridgment of the right of any United States citizen to vote based on his race or color or membership in a language minority group.

HISTORY: ["01/10/2021 - PREFILED.","01/13/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/13/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","01/20/2021 - From HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Reported favorably.","01/22/2021 - Engrossed by HOUSE.","01/25/2021 - Passed HOUSE.  *****To SENATE.","01/26/2021 - To SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","02/05/2021 - In SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Continued to 2021 Special Session I.","02/16/2021 - From SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Reported favorably.","02/19/2021 - Passed SENATE.","02/24/2021 - Eligible for GOVERNOR'S desk.","03/18/2021 - Signed by GOVERNOR.","03/18/2021 - Acts of Assembly.  Chapter No. 163"]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to assistance for certain voters, relates to curbside voting, clarifies that any voter with a permanent physical disability, temporary physical disability, or injury is entitled to vote outside of the polling place, further provides that during a declared state of emergency related to a communicable disease of public health threat, any voter shall be entitled to vote outside of the polling place.

HISTORY: ["01/11/2021 - PREFILED.","01/13/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/13/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","01/20/2021 - From HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Reported favorably.","01/22/2021 - Engrossed by HOUSE.","01/25/2021 - Passed HOUSE.  *****To SENATE.","01/26/2021 - To SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","02/05/2021 - In SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Continued to 2021 Special Session I.","02/16/2021 - From SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Reported favorably.","02/19/2021 - Passed SENATE.","02/24/2021 - Eligible for GOVERNOR'S desk.","03/18/2021 - Signed by GOVERNOR.","03/18/2021 - Acts of Assembly. BILLSUMMARY: Relates to absentee voting, relates to early in person, relates to availability on Sundays, permits the electoral board or general registrar of a county or city to provide absentee voting in person in the office of the general registrar or voter satellite office on Sundays.

HISTORY: ["01/11/2021 - PREFILED.","01/13/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/13/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","02/05/2021 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Left in committee."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to voter identification, relates to identification containing a photograph required, requires presentation of a form of identification containing a photograph in order to vote, repeals the provisions of law permitting a voter who does not have one of the required forms of identification to vote after signing a statement, subject to felony penalties for false statements, that he is the named registered voter he claims to be.

HISTORY: ["01/12/2021 - PREFILED.","01/13/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/13/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","02/05/2021 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Left in committee."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to absentee ballots, relates to witness requirement, relates to printed name and residence address, requires that a witness to a voter's absentee ballot provide, in addition to his signature, his printed name and residence address.

HISTORY: ["01/12/2021 - PREFILED.","01/13/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/13/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","01/20/2021 - From HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Reported favorably.","01/22/2021 - Engrossed by HOUSE.","01/25/2021 - Passed HOUSE.  *****To SENATE.","01/26/2021 - To SENATE Committee on JUDICIARY.","02/05/2021 - In SENATE Committee on JUDICIARY:  Continued to 2021 Special Session I.","02/15/2021 - From SENATE Committee on JUDICIARY:  Reported favorably.","02/18/2021 - Passed SENATE.","02/22/2021 - Eligible for GOVERNOR'S desk.","03/31/2021 - Signed by GOVERNOR.","03/31/2021 - Acts of Assembly.  Chapter No. 459"]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to polling places, relates to prohibited activities, relates to unlawful possession of a firearm, relates to penalty, prohibits any person from knowingly possessing a firearm within 40 feet of any building, or part thereof, used as a polling place, including one hour before and one hour after its use as a polling place, except for a qualified law-enforcement officer or retired law-enforcement officer, any person occupying his own private property that falls within 40 feet of the polling place.

HISTORY: ["01/12/2021 - PREFILED.","01/13/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/13/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","02/03/2021 - From HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Reported with substitute.","02/03/2021 - Committee substitute printed.","02/04/2021 - Committee substitute adopted on HOUSE floor.","02/04/2021 - Engrossed by HOUSE as substituted.","02/05/2021 - Passed HOUSE.  *****To SENATE.","02/05/2021 - To SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","02/05/2021 - In SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Continued to 2021 Special Session I.","02/16/2021 - In SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Passed by indefinitely."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to redistricting, relates to Virginia Redistricting Commission, relates to transparency in redistricting process, relates to reallocation of prison population, requires meetings and hearings of the Virginia Redistricting Commission to be livestreamed, whether held virtually or in person, and to allow for public comment, meetings and hearings that are held in person are required to be conducted in different regions of the Commonwealth, including the Northern Virginia region.

HISTORY: ["01/12/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/12/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","01/27/2021 - From HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Reported with amendment.","01/29/2021 - Committee amendment adopted on HOUSE floor.","01/29/2021 - Engrossed by HOUSE as amended.","02/01/2021 - Passed HOUSE.  *****To SENATE.","02/02/2021 - To SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","02/05/2021 - In SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Continued to 2021 Special Session I.","02/16/2021 - From SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Reported favorably.","02/19/2021 - Passed SENATE.","02/24/2021 - Eligible for GOVERNOR'S desk.","03/18/2021 - Signed by GOVERNOR.","03/18/2021 - Acts of Assembly.  Chapter No. 217"]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to voter registration, relates to preregistration for persons 16 years of age or older, permits a person who is otherwise qualified to register to vote and is 16 years of age or older, but who will not be 18 years of age on or before the day of the next general election, to preregister to vote, provides that the preregistration does not entitle such person to vote in any election except as already permitted by law.

HISTORY: ["01/12/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/12/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","01/20/2021 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Failed to report."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to assistance to certain voters, relates to curbside voting, relates to right to observe ballot deposited into ballot scanner machine or ballot container, provides that, upon the request of the voter, a curbside voter shall be permitted to enter the polling place after marking his ballot in order to observe his ballot being deposited into the ballot container or ballot scanner machine.

HISTORY: ["01/13/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/13/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","02/05/2021 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Left in committee."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to same-day voter registration, relates to repeal, repeals Chapter 1153 of the Acts of Assembly of 2020, which provided that any person who is qualified to register to vote would be permitted to do so up to and including on the day of the election, regardless of the close of the registration records provided elsewhere in law.

HISTORY: ["01/13/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/13/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","02/05/2021 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Left in committee."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to absentee voting, relates to signature match, relates to provisional ballot status, requires the signature on the voter affirmation statement on an absentee ballot return envelope to match the signature of the voter on the application for the absentee ballot or the signature of the voter on file in his registration record, provides that the general registrars are required to review the affirmation statement upon receipt of an absentee ballot returned by mail and to compare the signatures.

HISTORY: ["01/13/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/13/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","02/05/2021 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Left in committee."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to elections, relates to offenses, relates to intimidation of or interference with authorized representatives of party or candidate, relates to penalty, makes willfully interfering, or attempting to interfere, with an authorized representative of a party or candidate in his lawful observation of an election a Class 3 misdemeanor.

HISTORY: ["01/13/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/13/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","02/05/2021 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Left in committee."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to voter identification, relates to optional restrictive identification requirement, allows a voter to opt into being required to show a valid photo identification issued by the Commonwealth, one of its political subdivisions, or the United States when voting in person, when a voter offers to vote and the pollbook indicates he has opted into such requirement, he shall be required to show a valid photo identification issued by the Commonwealth, one of its political subdivisions, or the United States.

HISTORY: ["01/13/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/13/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","02/05/2021 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Left in committee."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to elections, relates to absentee voting, relates to ballots to be processed before election day and sorted and counted by precinct, requires certain actions to be taken to process absentee ballots that are returned by mail before election day.

HISTORY: ["01/14/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/14/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","02/05/2021 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Left in committee."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to voter registration, relates to political party affiliation, relates to closed primary elections, adds political party affiliation to the information that an applicant is asked to provide when registering to vote.

HISTORY: ["01/22/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/22/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","01/27/2021 - From HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Reported with substitute.","01/27/2021 - Committee substitute printed.","01/29/2021 - Committee substitute adopted on HOUSE floor.","01/29/2021 - Engrossed by HOUSE as substituted.","02/01/2021 - Passed HOUSE.  *****To SENATE.","02/01/2021 - Reconsidered.","02/01/2021 - Passed HOUSE.  *****To SENATE.","02/02/2021 - To SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","02/05/2021 - In SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Continued to 2021 Special Session I.","02/16/2021 - From SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Reported favorably.","02/19/2021 - Failed to pass SENATE."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to removing a citizen commissioner of the Virginia Redistricting Commission for neglect of duty or gross misconduct.

HISTORY: "02/15/2022 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Left in committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Proposes a constitutional amendment, relates to qualifications of voters and the right to vote, relates to persons not entitled to vote, provides that every person who meets the qualifications of voters set forth in the Constitution shall have the fundamental right to vote in the Commonwealth and that such right shall not be abridged by law, except for persons who have been convicted of a felony and persons who have been adjudicated.

HISTORY: "02/15/2022 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Left in committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Proposes a constitutional amendment relating to qualifications of voters and the right to vote, relates to persons not entitled to vote, provides that every person who meets the qualifications of voters set forth in the Constitution shall have the fundamental right to vote in the Commonwealth and that such right shall not be abridged by law, except for persons who have been convicted of a felony and specified other persons.

HISTORY: "02/15/2022 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Left in committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Proposes a constitutional amendment, relates to qualifications of voters and the right to vote, relates to persons not entitled to vote, provides that every person who meets the qualifications of voters set forth in the Constitution shall have the fundamental right to vote in the Commonwealth and that such right shall not be abridged by law, except for persons who have been convicted of a felony and persons who have been adjudicated.

HISTORY: ["01/07/2020 - PREFILED.","01/08/2020 - INTRODUCED.","01/08/2020 - To HOUSE Committee on RULES.","01/31/2020 - In HOUSE Committee on RULES:  Continued to 2021."]
BILLSUMMARY: Proposes a constitutional amendment, relates to qualifications of voters, relates to restoration of civil rights by general law, authorizes the General Assembly to provide by general law for the restoration of civil rights for persons convicted of nonviolent felonies who have completed service of their sentences subject to the conditions, requirements, and definitions set forth in that law.

HISTORY: ["01/16/2020 - INTRODUCED.","01/16/2020 - To HOUSE Committee on RULES.","01/31/2020 - In HOUSE Committee on RULES:  Continued to 2021."]
BILLSUMMARY: Proposes a constitutional amendment (first resolution), relates to apportionment, relates to criteria for legislative and congressional districts, relates to Virginia Citizens Redistricting Commission, provides for the establishment of the Virginia Citizens Redistricting Commission (the Commission), a 10-member commission responsible for establishing legislative and congressional districts following a decennial census.

HISTORY: ["01/12/2021 - PREFILED.","01/13/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/13/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","02/03/2021 - From HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Reported as substituted, see HJR 555."]
BILLSUMMARY: Proposes a constitutional amendment (first reference), relates to franchise and officers, relates to felon disenfranchisement, relates to automatic restoration of political rights, provides that no person who has been convicted of a felony shall be qualified to vote until the completion of his sentence of imprisonment or active supervision, at which time, without further action required of him, his political rights, including the right to vote, shall be restored.

HISTORY: ["01/12/2021 - PREFILED.","01/13/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/13/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","02/05/2021 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Left in committee."]
BILLSUMMARY: Proposes a constitutional amendment (first reference), relates to qualifications of voters, relates to 16-year-olds permitted to vote, provides that, notwithstanding the requirement that a voter shall be 18 years of age, any person who is 16 years of age or older and is otherwise qualified to vote shall be permitted to register to vote and to vote in local elections.

BILLSUMMARY: Relates to elections, relates to lists of persons voting at elections, relates to disclosure of individual voting history prohibited, prohibits certain persons in receipt of a list of persons voting at elections from disclosing the voting history of any individual on such list to a third party.

BILLSUMMARY: Relates to absentee voting, relates to permanent absentee voter list repealed, repeals the provisions of law by which any registered voter may apply to receive absentee ballots for all elections in which he is eligible to vote and remains on the list until the voter requests in writing to be removed from the list, the voter's registration is canceled or placed on inactive status pursuant to law, or the voter moves to a different address not in the same county or city of his registration.

HISTORY: "01/25/2022 - In SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Passed by indefinitely."
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to voter registration, relates to registration permitted up to and including the day of the election, repeals a provision that would permit any person who is qualified to register to vote to register to vote in person up to and including the day of the election, notwithstanding any deadline for the close of registration records, provides that the repeal will limit the persons who are entitled to register to vote after the close of registration records to any member of a uniformed service.

HISTORY: "01/25/2022 - In SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Passed by indefinitely."
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to absentee voting, relates to return of absentee ballots, relates to drop-off locations, repeals the provisions of law providing for the establishment of drop-off locations for the return of absentee ballots.

BILLSUMMARY: Relates to standards and criteria for congressional and state legislative districts, provides criteria by which congressional and state legislative districts are to be drawn, including equal population, racial and ethnic fairness, protection of racial and language minorities to participate and elect a preferred candidate, contiguity, and compactness.

BILLSUMMARY: NA

BILLSUMMARY: Relates to State Board of Elections, relates to membership, relates to appointment of Commissioner of Elections, expands the membership of the State Board of Elections from five members to eight members with equal representation given to both parties, gives the State Board of Elections the authority and duty to appoint the Commissioner of Elections of the Department of Elections, provides that the appointment and removal of the Commissioner require an affirmative vote of six of the eight board members.

HISTORY: "01/25/2022 - In SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Passed by indefinitely."
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to elections, relates to administration, relates to registrars, relates to certain prohibitions, requires the State Board of Elections to establish and the Department of Elections to conduct a program for the evaluation of the performance of general registrars, provides that under such evaluation program, general registrars with below satisfactory performance are subject to remedial requirements and possible removal.

BILLSUMMARY: Relates to absentee voting, provides that excuse required to vote absentee by mail, provides that signature match, requires a registered voter to provide a reason for being absent or unable to vote at his polling place on election day in order to receive an absentee ballot to vote by mail, requires a voter voting absentee by mail to open his ballot in the presence of a notary who must sign the ballot return envelope.

HISTORY: "02/01/2022 - In SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Passed by indefinitely."
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to elections, relates to voter registration, relates to lists of registered voters, relates to provided to registered voters, provides that the Department of Elections must provide the lists for their districts to any registered voter of the Commonwealth for a reasonable charge not to exceed its actual cost incurred in supplying the requested records.

BILLSUMMARY: Relates to voter registration, relates to automatic voter registration, provides for the automatic electronic transmission by the Department of Motor Vehicles to the Department of Elections of certain information for any individual who is not registered to vote, is of sufficient age to register to vote, conducts a transaction with the Department of Motor Vehicles to apply for a new driver's license or special identification card or replace, renew, or update an existing driver's license.

BILLSUMMARY: Relates to voter registration, relates to verification of social security numbers, relates to provisional registration status, requires the general registrars to verify that the name, date of birth, and social security number provided by an applicant on the voter registration application match the information on file in the Social Security Administration database or other database approved by the State Board of Elections (the State Board) before registering such applicant.

BILLSUMMARY: Relates to absentee voting, relates to third-party absentee ballot assembly and distribution, permits a general registrar to contract with a third party for the printing, assembly, and mailing of absentee ballots, directs the State Board of Elections to adopt emergency regulations to implement the provisions of the bill and for those regulations to include processes to ensure secure and timely delivery of voter information to contractors and reports of mailed absentee ballots from contractors.
