BILLSUMMARY: Relates to absentee voting, relates to establishment of drop-off locations, relates to ballot defects, relates to cure process, requires the establishment of a drop-off location for the return of marked absentee ballots at the Office of the general registrar and each voter satellite office, provides that on the day of any election, a drop-off location shall be available at each polling place in operation for such election.

BILLSUMMARY: Relates to absentee voting, relates to mandatory processing of returned absentee ballots before election day, relates to central absentee voter precinct in the office of the general registrar, requires certain actions to be taken to process absentee ballots that are returned by mail before election day, provides that the general registrar is required to examine the ballot envelopes to verify completion of the required voter affirmation.

HISTORY: ["01/12/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/12/2021 - To SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","01/26/2021 - From SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Reported favorably.","01/29/2021 - Engrossed by SENATE.","02/01/2021 - Passed SENATE.  *****To HOUSE.","02/01/2021 - Reconsidered.","02/01/2021 - Passed SENATE.  *****To HOUSE.","02/04/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","02/08/2021 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Continued to 2021 Special Session I.","02/17/2021 - From HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Reported with amendment.","02/22/2021 - Committee amendment adopted on HOUSE floor.","02/22/2021 - Engrossed by HOUSE as amended.","02/22/2021 - Passed HOUSE.  *****To SENATE for concurrence.","02/23/2021 - SENATE concurred in HOUSE amendments.","02/25/2021 - Eligible for GOVERNOR'S desk.","03/18/2021 - Signed by GOVERNOR.","03/18/2021 - Acts of Assembly. BILLSUMMARY: Relates to absentee voting, relates to accessibility for voters with a visual impairment or print disability, requires the Department of Elections to make available to all localities a tool to allow voters with a visual impairment or print disability to electronically and accessibly receive and mark his absentee ballot using screen reader assistive technology.

HISTORY: ["01/13/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/13/2021 - To SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","01/26/2021 - From SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Reported as substituted, see SB 1246."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to absentee voting, relates to processing of absentee ballots before election day, relates to reporting of absentee ballot vote totals, relates to central absentee voter precincts, requires certain actions to be taken to process absentee ballots returned before the day of the election, including opening sealed ballot envelopes and inserting the ballot into a ballot container or counting machine, requires the establishment of a central absentee voter precinct in each locality.

BILLSUMMARY: Relates to elections, relates to prohibited discrimination in voting and elections administration, relates to required process for enacting certain covered practices, relates to civil causes of action, prohibits any voting qualification or any standard, practice, or procedure related to voting from being imposed or applied in a manner that results in the denial or abridgment of the right of any United States citizen to vote based on his race or color or membership in a language minority group.

HISTORY: ["01/13/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/13/2021 - To SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","01/26/2021 - From SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Reported favorably.","01/29/2021 - Engrossed by SENATE.","02/01/2021 - Passed SENATE.  *****To HOUSE.","02/04/2021 - To HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","02/08/2021 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Continued to 2021 Special Session I.","02/10/2021 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Tabled."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to voter registration, relates to list maintenance, relates to lists of decedents transmitted by State Registrar of Vital Records, requires the State Registrar of Vital Records to transmit to the Department of Elections a weekly list of decedents from the previous week, currently, this list is transmitted monthly, requires the general registrars to use this information to conduct list maintenance and to promptly cancel the registration of a person on the list.

HISTORY: ["01/20/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/20/2021 - To SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","01/26/2021 - In SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Passed by indefinitely."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to absentee ballots, relates to witness requirement, relates to printed name and residence address, requires that a witness to a voter's absentee ballot provide, in addition to his signature, his printed name and residence address.

HISTORY: ["01/21/2021 - INTRODUCED.","01/21/2021 - To SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","01/26/2021 - In SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Passed by indefinitely."]
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to conduct of elections, relates to voter identification and absentee voting, relates to process for applying for, casting, and counting absentee ballots, requires presentation of a form of identification containing a photograph in order to vote, eliminates current provisions permitting a voter who does not have one of the required forms of identification to vote after signing a statement, subject to felony penalties for false statements, that he is the named registered voter he claims to be.

HISTORY: "03/08/2022 - In HOUSE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Left in committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Proposes a constitutional amendment (second reference), relates to qualifications of voters and the right to vote, relates to persons not entitled to vote, provides that every person who meets the qualifications of voters set forth in the Constitution shall have the fundamental right to vote in the Commonwealth and that such right shall not be abridged by law, except for persons who have been convicted of a felony and persons who have been adjudicated to lack the/.

HISTORY: ["12/03/2019 - PREFILED.","12/03/2019 - To SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","01/08/2020 - INTRODUCED.","01/08/2020 - To SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","01/21/2020 - In SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Continued to 2021."]
BILLSUMMARY: Proposes a constitutional amendment (first resolution), relates to qualifications of voters and the right to vote, establishes that the only qualifications to vote in the Commonwealth are United States citizenship, being at least 18 years of age, residency in the Commonwealth, and registration to vote in accordance with the requirements set out in the Constitution of Virginia.

HISTORY: ["12/30/2019 - PREFILED.","12/30/2019 - To SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","01/08/2020 - INTRODUCED.","01/08/2020 - To SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","01/21/2020 - In SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Continued to 2021."]
BILLSUMMARY: Proposes a constitutional amendment (first resolution), relates to qualifications of voters, relates to restoration of civil rights by general law, authorizes the General Assembly to provide by general law for the restoration of civil rights for persons convicted of a felony, relate to the present Constitution providing for restoration of rights by the Governor, and the amendment retains this right.

HISTORY: ["01/02/2020 - PREFILED.","01/02/2020 - To SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","01/08/2020 - INTRODUCED.","01/08/2020 - To SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","01/21/2020 - In SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Continued to 2021."]
BILLSUMMARY: Proposes a constitutional amendment (first resolution), relates to political reform, prohibits the establishment of electoral districts that intentionally or unduly favor or disfavor any political party and requires the General Assembly to regulate the role of money in elections and governance to ensure transparency, to prevent corruption, and to protect against the buying of access to or influence over elected officials.

HISTORY: "03/08/2022 - In HOUSE Committee on RULES:  Left in committee."
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to study, relates to JLARC, relates to election governance structure, relates to report, directs the Joint Legislative Audit and Review Commission to conduct a study on the election governance structure in the Commonwealth, and in doing so, review the roles and responsibilities of state and local election officials in the administration and conduct of elections in the Commonwealth, including the level of oversight by state election officials and the degree of decision-making by local election.

HISTORY: "01/28/2022 - In SENATE Committee on RULES:  Passed by indefinitely."
BILLSUMMARY: Relates to study, relates to Secretary of Administration, relates to theState Board of Elections and electronic return of voted military overseas ballots, provides for a pilot program and report, requests the Secretary of Administration to oversee and develop a charter and directives for the State Board of Elections to form a working group to study implementation of electronic return of voted military overseas ballots.

HISTORY: ["01/08/2020 - INTRODUCED.","01/08/2020 - To SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.","01/21/2020 - In SENATE Committee on PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS:  Continued to 2021."]
BILLSUMMARY: Proposes a constitutional amendment (first resolution), relates to qualifications of voters, relates to automatic restoration of civil rights, provides for the automatic restoration of civil rights for persons convicted of felonies upon completion of their sentences, provides for restoration of rights by the Governor, and the amendment retains this right.
